0.title: WHO confirms one child has died in mystery liver disease outbreak
0.article_body: The WHO confirmed at least one death in connection with a mysterious liver disease outbreak affecting children in Europe and the US. "As of April 21, at least 169 cases of acute hepatitis of unknown origin have been reported from 11 countries," WHO said. "Cases are aged 1 month to 16 years old. Seventeen children required liver transplantation," WHO added.

1.title: Johar pens poem on 'Rocky Aur Rani...' cast, calls Alia 'box office ki maharani'
1.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar, taking to Instagram on Sunday, penned a poem praising the cast of his upcoming movie 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani'. In the poem, Johar called actress Alia Bhatt "box office ki maharani". At the end of his poem, he announced that 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani' will release on February 10 next year.

2.title: My god, people are crazy: Singer Sunitha reacts on her pregnancy rumours
2.article_body: Singer Sunitha dismissed the rumours of her being pregnant. This came after she posted a picture holding a mango and that caused rumours of the singer expecting a child with her husband. Taking to Instagram, Sunitha wrote, "My god...people are crazy...I posted a picture today with my first mango crop and the news spreads like this. Stop assuming things."

3.title: Anupam Kher shares his before-after pic, says 'Face has changed but fire in eyes is same'
3.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher took to Instagram to share a before-after picture of himself. He wrote, "Face has changed. But the fire and the hunger in the eyes is the same!" He added, "The pic on the left is from a portfolio shoot I did when I came to the #CityOfDreams, Mumbai, in 1981." "So inspiring journey," a user commented.

4.title: Sehwag shares video of him eating banana as birthday gift to Sachin Tendulkar
4.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag took to Twitter to wish Sachin Tendulkar on his 49th birthday. Sehwag shared a video, wherein he revealed that Sachin always expected him to be quiet in the dressing room during matches. "Sachin used to feed me bananas so that I kept quiet," he said. "I won't say anything today, I will eat bananas," he added.

5.title: It's overwhelming when I see a meme about Munna Bhaiya: Divyenndu
5.article_body: Speaking about his character 'Munna Bhaiya' in 'Mirzapur,' actor Divyenndu Sharma said it's overwhelming to see people still love the character so much. "Mirzapur 2 was released...long time back but still every day on social media, I see a...meme or reel about Munna Bhaiya," he added.  "People actually believe that in some parallel universe...[Munna Tripathi] really exists," he said.

6.title: Destroyed Odesa depot where foreign weapons were stored: Russia
6.article_body: Russia has claimed that it destroyed a logistics terminal in Ukraine's Odesa where a huge cache of weapons from foreign countries were stored. It said that weapons from the US and European countries were destroyed using high-precision missiles. It further said that up to 200 Ukrainian soldiers were killed and over 30 vehicles were destroyed on Saturday.

7.title: Auto-rickshaw driver abuses woman for not cancelling ride in Gurugram
7.article_body: Gurugram Police booked an Ola auto-rickshaw driver for allegedly misbehaving with a woman passenger and abusing her for not cancelling the ride, officials said on Saturday. The woman alleged that she tried contacting Ola support, but it showed that they had already resolved the matter without a follow-up. Officials said they let the driver off on police bail.

8.title: Minor says she wants to leave past baggage, Bombay HC quashes FIR against rape accused
8.article_body: Bombay High Court has quashed an FIR against a 20-year-old man from Pune, accused of raping a minor girl. The survivor said that as she wishes to pursue further studies, the pendency of criminal proceedings will be a hurdle and she wants to "leave behind the baggage of the past" and concentrate on the "positive side for a better future".

9.title: Had traumatic experience with close family at 6, turned extreme: Munawar
9.article_body: In a promo shared by ALTBalaji for reality show 'Lock Upp', contestant Munawar Faruqui recounted his traumatic experience involving close family at age six. He said he didn't understand it at the time and it continued for four-five years but turned extreme in the fourth year. "I've never shared this with anyone because I have to face them," Munawar said.

10.title: Ashish Mishra surrenders after SC rejects bail in Lakhimpur case; sent back to jail
10.article_body: Union Minister Ajay Mishra Teni's son Ashish Mishra, who is accused of killing farmers in Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri last year, on Sunday surrendered before police and was sent back to prison. The Supreme Court had last week cancelled his bail and given him a week to surrender. Ashish was granted bail by Allahabad High Court in February this year.

11.title: 'Mirzapur' script didn't allow me to explore my character: Shriya Pilgaonkar
11.article_body: Actress Shriya Pilgaonkar, who played a character named Sweety Gupta in 'Mirzapur', has said the web show's script didn't allow her to explore her character. "Although I love my character in 'Mirzapur', there was a lot I could do as Sweety Gupta," she added. Shriya's character died in the finale episode of Mirzapur's inaugural season.

12.title: Russian opposition activist jailed for denouncing war in Ukraine
12.article_body: Russia has placed an activist accused of maligning country’s armed forces in pre-trial detention till June. Vladimir Kara-Murza Jr. was charged for a speech he made to Arizona House of Representatives, wherein he denounced Ukraine's invasion, his lawyer claimed. Russia recently adopted law criminalising spread of "fake" news about its armed forces with jail term of up to 15 years.

13.title: Motivating to grab eyeballs even before my work is out: Rashmika
13.article_body: Actress Rashmika Mandanna has stated that it feels super motivating to grab eyeballs even before her work has come out. "I don't want to look at it as pressure because from what I've seen from the North, they're all...amazing," she added. Rashmika has 'Mission Majnu' with Sidharth Malhotra, 'Goodbye' with Amitabh Bachchan and 'Animal' with Ranbir Kapoor in the pipeline.

14.title: There's a difference in his bowling, he's not bowling with seam: RP Singh on Siraj
14.article_body: Ex-India pacer RP Singh has said there's a difference in Mohammed Siraj's bowling this season. "In the earlier seasons, Siraj used to hit the deck with seam, extracting a good bounce from the surface. Now, you don't see him bowling with the seam...He needs to go back to his basics," explained Singh. Siraj has picked six wickets in eight games.

15.title: FPIs, net sellers since Oct, withdraw ₹12,286 cr between Apr 1-22
15.article_body: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) withdrew net ₹12,286 crore between April 1-22, data with depositories showed. FPIs had withdrawn ₹1.48 lakh crore between October 2021 and March 2022 and became net investors between April 1-8, for the first time in six months, by investing net ₹7,707 crore. They have been net sellers since then, withdrawing ₹4,500 crore between April 11-13.

16.title: Makeup Amber 'used to hide bruises by Depp' launched after their divorce: Milani
16.article_body: Actress Amber Heard had claimed she carried Milani's All-In-One Correcting Kit with her to cover up bruises she allegedly received from her husband Johnny Depp. The makeup brand, however, claimed the product wasn't launched until after the couple divorced in 2016. Milani Cosmetics said the kit, presented during Depp's defamation suit trial against Heard, was launched in December 2017.

17.title: Punishment doesn't fit crime: Terry Crews on Will slapping Chris
17.article_body: Actor Terry Crews has lent support for Will Smith in the 2022 Oscars slap incident involving Chris Rock, saying that the punishment does not fit the crime. Will has been banned from the Academy for ten years for slapping Chris. "I love them both as brothers but there was a time...I was Will Smith...and...I've done worse than Will," Terry said.

18.title: The OG ladykiller: Arjun Kapoor shares fan's post featuring his throwback pics
18.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor shared a fan's post featuring his old pictures, as he started shooting for his new film 'The Lady Killer'. Taking to Instagram Stories, Arjun posted the collage of his throwback pictures which showed the actor with long hair and dressed in different outfits. Sharing the post, Arjun wrote, "The OG ladykiller."

19.title: Don't know why MI didn't go back to Marco Jansen: SRH batting coach Lara
19.article_body: Following a nine-wicket win over RCB, SRH batting coach Brian Lara praised pacer Marco Jansen who scalped three wickets in the match. "I don't know why Mumbai [Indians] didn't go back to Jansen. He is an awesome talent," Lara said. Jansen, who was part of MI in IPL 2021, was bought by SRH for ₹4.2 crore in the mega auction.

20.title: We're making sure players understand their roles: Moody on SRH's 5th win
20.article_body: SRH head coach Tom Moody has said role clarity is one of the reasons for their five-match winning streak in IPL 2022. "We make sure that players [understand] their roles...and when they are called upon in certain stages [they deliver]," he stated. "We're very specific in our training as to where we are playing, who the opposition is," Moody added.

21.title: Priest stabbed multiple times, nun hurt in France church
21.article_body: A priest was reportedly stabbed multiple times in a church in France's Nice on Sunday. A nun, who tried to snatch the knife from the attacker, was hurt in the arm. According to Nice mayor Christian Estrosi, the attacker was mentally unstable and had no past criminal record. The 31-year-old attacker has been arrested.

22.title: Neutral faces are not sad faces: Ira on people saying she looks 'very serious'
22.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan’s daughter Ira Khan took to her Instagram Stories to post her selfie, saying people have told her she looks “very serious”."This is my normal face...It's not smiley or happy but it's not unhappy either. I'd say it is pretty neutral," she said, adding, "What I was trying to say is...neutral faces are not sad faces."

23.title: I felt lost all the time: Shamita Shetty on her battle with depression
23.article_body: Actress and 'Bigg Boss 15' contestant Shamita Shetty spoke about overcoming depression on her sister Shilpa Shetty's chat show 'Shape of You'. Shamita said, "When I went through that phase, I didn't even know I was in depression...I felt lost all the time." "I was dating someone at the time and he told me 'there is something wrong'," she added.

24.title: Hardik Pandya is best suited option for Team India at no. 4: Irfan Pathan
24.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan has said Gujarat Titans captain Hardik Pandya is the "best suited" option for Team India at the number four position. "This is a new Hardik. This is a better version of him. It was nice to see the situations in which he has played," Irfan added. Hardik is currently the second-highest scorer in IPL 2022.

25.title: MBA grad who was arrested for stealing over 60 cars moved to Hyd from B'luru
25.article_body: An MBA graduate who is accused of stealing over 60 cars was moved to Hyderabad from Bengaluru on a prisoner transit. He was arrested in his hometown Jaipur last month and brought to Bengaluru. In January 2021, he had allegedly stolen a Toyota Fortuner car belonging to Kannada film producer Manjunath from a five-star hotel.

26.title: J&K's Palli becomes India's first carbon neutral panchayat
26.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday inaugurated a 500 KW solar power plant at Jammu and Kashmir's Palli, making it India's first carbon neutral panchayat. "The people of Palli have demonstrated what 'sabka prayas' (everybody’s efforts) can do," he said. Earlier, Union Minister Jitendra Singh had said that the solar power plant was completed in a record time of 20 days.

27.title: Against whom did Sachin Tendulkar score the most international hundreds?
27.article_body: Sachin Tendulkar, who turns 49 today, scored 100 international hundreds in his career spanning 664 matches. Sachin's most international hundreds came against Australia (20), followed by Sri Lanka (17) and South Africa (12). He slammed nine hundreds each against New Zealand and England. Sachin scored 53 of his 100 hundreds in winning cause. Sachin hit six hundreds in World Cups.

28.title: Rajiv Gandhi introduced Panchayati Raj system, fulfilled Gandhiji’s dream: Rahul
28.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Sunday said ex-PM Rajiv Gandhi fulfilled Mahatma Gandhi’s dream of strengthening villages by giving the Panchayati Raj System to the country. "It was Mahatma Gandhi’s dream that the villages of the country should become strong," Rahul Gandhi tweeted on the occasion of the National Panchayati Raj Day.

29.title: Delhi Police crackdown on gang making counterfeit ₹10 coins
29.article_body: Five people were arrested by the Delhi Police on Friday for being involved in making counterfeit ₹10 coins. The main accused, a businessman, was running four units outside the national capital to manufacture the coins and had 500 kg of raw material for the same. The police also seized coins with face value of over ₹10 lakh from the accused.

30.title: Monkey born with 'Batman' symbol on face in US zoo; pic released
30.article_body: A US zoo has announced the birth of a spider monkey with a 'Batman' symbol on the face. "Keepers were surprised to see the baby's unique markings, noting the resemblance to the Batman symbol," the zoo said. The symbol of a bat extending its wings is used throughout the DC Comics as a distress signal to summon the superhero Batman.

31.title: Tiger recreates 'choti bacchi ho kya' dialogue at event after memes go viral
31.article_body: Actor Tiger Shroff recreated the "choti bacchi ho kya" dialogue from his debut film 'Heropanti' during a recent event, days after memes using the dialogue went viral on social media. The actor recreated the dialogue during an event for his upcoming film, 'Heropanti 2'. Several social media users reacted to Tiger's video, with one tweeting, "Finally from the legend himself."

32.title: Billionaire Jack Dorsey drops his CEO title at Block, calls himself 'Block Head'
32.article_body: Twitter's billionaire Co-founder Jack Dorsey, who Co-founded fintech startup Block (previously Square), has changed his title of CEO at Block to 'Block Head and Chairperson'. "There will be no changes in Dorsey's roles and responsibilities," Block said in a regulatory filing. World's richest person Elon Musk tweeted to Dorsey, "Your new title at Block is...," followed by two fire emojis.

33.title: Black-coloured horse bought for ₹23 lakh in Punjab turns brown on being washed
33.article_body: A man in Punjab was cheated out of ₹22.65 lakh by a trader who sold him a black-coloured horse claiming it's a highly sought-after and rare breed from the Marwar region. The alleged victim Ramesh Singh said it turned reddish-brown after he gave it a bath. Police have filed a case of fraud against three people.

34.title: India seeing digital transactions worth ₹20,000 cr daily: PM
34.article_body: PM Narendra Modi in his 'Mann Ki Baat' radio programme on Sunday said digital transactions worth ₹20,000 crore are now taking place daily in the country. "In March, UPI transactions even reached ₹10 lakh crore," PM Modi stated. He urged the public to go for 'Cashless Day Out', adding that digital transactions boost facilities and encourage honesty.

35.title: Tata Motors also hikes vehicle prices after Maruti Suzuki
35.article_body: Tata Motors on Saturday said it has hiked the prices of its passenger vehicles by an average of 1.1% with immediate effect to partially offset the rise in input cost. This comes after Maruti Suzuki increased the prices of all its models by 1.3% on April 18. Last month, Tata Motors announced a 2-2.5% price hike on commercial vehicles.

36.title: If you're snooty & don't reach out for work, it's end of road: Aparshakti
36.article_body: Actor Aparshakti Khurana has stated that reaching out to relevant people for work is a very regular process. "If you become a snob or snooty, that's the end of the road for you," he added. He said you don't need to chase the world beyond a point but have to make time for people who want to work with you.

37.title: Real estate agent rapes 24-yr-old hairdresser in Pune, arrested
37.article_body: Police have arrested a real estate agent for allegedly raping a 24-year-old hairdresser when she had gone to see a house in Pune, an official said on Sunday. On Friday night, the accused called the woman to see a house and took her to his residence, where he raped her and recorded the act, police said.

38.title: GHMC to set up 53 theme parks in Hyderabad to improve green cover
38.article_body: Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) will set up as many as 53 new theme parks in the city to improve its green cover. Civil works are reportedly in progress in 25 of these upcoming spaces, while the development of the remaining parks is under various stages of implementation. Notably, these spaces will include exclusive play areas for children.

39.title: Ronaldo points to the sky after scoring goal vs Arsenal, dedicates it to late baby son
39.article_body: Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo dedicated his goal against Arsenal on Saturday to his late baby son. After scoring in the 34th minute, Ronaldo looked towards the sky and pointed towards it as a tribute to his late baby son. Ronaldo also took to Instagram to share a picture and posted a heart emoji in the caption.

40.title: Man tries to murder woman who accused him of rape in Bengaluru
40.article_body: A case has been filed after a man, who was out on bail, and his two associates allegedly tried to murder a 41-year-old woman who had previously accused him of rape. The trio was reportedly trying to pressurise the woman to not file objections against the man's plea to get the rape case quashed. The incident occurred on April 19.

41.title: AAP welcomes Kerala officials at Delhi school; Kerala govt denies sending anyone
41.article_body: After AAP MLA Atishi welcomed Kerala officials at a Delhi government school and said they wanted to replicate the model in their state, Kerala Education Minister V Sivankutty said the state government hadn't sent anyone to Delhi. "At the same time, all assistance was provided to officials who had visited from Delhi to study 'Kerala Model' last month," Sivankutty added.

42.title: Madhya Pradesh CM announces ₹1 cr for family of personnel who died in J&K
42.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan has announced relief of ₹1 crore for the family of Assistant Sub-Inspector Shankar Prasad Patel, who lost his life in Jammu and Kashmir on Friday. Chouhan has also promised a government job to a family member of security personnel. The state government will also name an institution after him as a tribute.

43.title: KKR is looking like a team who don't have an idea whom to play: Aakash
43.article_body: Aakash Chopra said KKR made a lot of changes going into the match against Gujarat Titans. "Kolkata is looking like a team who don't have an idea whom to play...they've...played four different opening pairs in eight matches," he stated. Aaron Finch, Sheldon Jackson and Pat Cummins were replaced by Sam Billings, Rinku Singh and Tim Southee against Gujarat Titans.

44.title: Muslim neighbours help family with Hindu woman's last rites in Mysuru
44.article_body: Realising that there were not many attendees, Muslim neighbours of a Hindu woman helped her family with her last rites in Karnataka's Mysuru. "Hers was only Hindu family here, but we all shared a great bond...When we heard about her sudden demise, we were shocked...least we could do was to lend our shoulder to carry the bier," a neighbour said.

45.title: IMF assures support to Sri Lanka in overcoming economic crisis
45.article_body: International Monetary Fund (IMF) has assured its support to the Sri Lankan government in overcoming the country's ongoing economic crisis. It termed the meeting with Sri Lankan Finance Minister Ali Sabry and Central Bank Governor Nandalal Weerasinghe as "fruitful". IMF said its team will work closely with authorities on their economic programme and engage with stakeholders to resolve the crisis.

46.title: Shifting down the batting order may just free Rohit Sharma up: Vettori
46.article_body: Ex-New Zealand captain Daniel Vettori said that Rohit Sharma should consider batting down the order for Mumbai Indians to "free him up". "Rohit opens for India...it's hard to put yourself down the order in these situations. But after the season they've had, it might be the right answer," he added. Rohit has scored 114 runs in 7 matches so far.

47.title: MPSC aspirant attacked with cement block by 3 phone robbers in Pune
47.article_body: A 28-year-old man, who is preparing for Maharashtra Public Service Commission exam, was allegedly chased and attacked with a cement block by three mobile phone robbers in Chinchwad area. The man received a serious injury on the right side of his head and is hospitalised. The incident took place when he had gone to purchase some books for MPSC exam.

48.title: I'm honoured to be Karan Johar's leading man: Ranveer on 'Rocky Aur Rani...'
48.article_body: Ranveer Singh, who'll be seen in Karan Johar's upcoming directorial titled 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani', said, "I'm honoured to be [Karan's] leading man." "He's made cult films that we have grown up on. It's a Karan Johar romantic family dramedy, a genre that he's full ownership of," he added. The film also stars Alia Bhatt and Shabana Azmi.

49.title: 7 from Sri Lanka among 143 officers graduated from Pune's military institute
49.article_body: As many as 143 military officers, including seven from Sri Lanka, graduated from Pune-based Military Institute of Technology (MILIT) after completing the Defence Services Technical Staff Course. Air Marshal BR Krishna stressed on the need to absorb and apply cutting edge technologies in the armed forces. He also advised the officers to utilise the knowledge in their assignments in future.

50.title: JMM leader shot dead in Jharkhand’s Latehar
50.article_body: Jharkhand Mukti Morcha (JMM) leader Dileshwar Khan was shot dead by unidentified persons on Sunday at Kusumahi railway siding in Latehar district. Based on the information collected so far, the police said that the victim, JMM Balumath block president, was attacked by six persons on two motorbikes. Khan was taken to a hospital where he was declared dead.

51.title: OTT gave me a new lease of life: Family Man & Scam 1992 actor Sharib
51.article_body: Sharib Hashmi, known for shows like 'The Family Man' and 'Scam 1992: The Harshad Mehta Story', said, "OTT gave me a new lease of life because my career was going through a rough patch...for a while." "Though I...[signed] a few films post 'Filmistaan', things didn't work out the way I [imagined]...and then I got Family Man, Scam 1992," he added.

52.title: Messi scores as PSG win record-equalling 10th Ligue 1 title with 4 matches to spare
52.article_body: Argentine forward Lionel Messi scored a 25-metre goal as PSG drew 1-1 against Lens to win their record equalling 10th Ligue 1 title. PSG equalled Marseille and Saint-Etienne's record for winning 10 French top-flight championships. PSG won the title with four league matches remaining in the season. PSG are on top of the table with 78 points from 34 matches.

53.title: T Natarajan wants to be on flight to Australia for WC: Gavaskar
53.article_body: Former India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said that SRH pacer T Natarajan, who's currently the second-highest wicket-taker in the ongoing IPL season, is bowling with full confidence in the tournament. "He recognises that there is a World Cup coming up, he wants to be on that flight to Australia," Gavaskar added. Natarajan registered figures of 3-0-10-3 against RCB.

54.title: Hyderabad Police avert child marriage bid, rescue minor girl
54.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police along with District Child Protection Officials averted a child marriage bid and rescued a minor girl in Kandukur Mandal on Saturday. The wedding, which was supposed to take place next week, was called off after police counselled the families. Rachakonda Police Commissioner Mahesh Bhagwat also shared a WhatsApp number through which citizens can report child marriages.

55.title: Ajit Pawar sanctions ₹1.5 cr for planned Pune leopard safari report
55.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar on Saturday sanctioned ₹1.5 crore for the preparation of a detailed project report on the planned leopard safari in Pune's Junnar. This comes as Pawar inaugurated the multispecialty hospital dedicated to wildlife animals in Manikdoh on the same day. Pawar said that the proposed leopard safari would also create job opportunities for local people.

56.title: Google adds 'reject all cookies' option in Europe after €150 mn fine
56.article_body: Google is introducing a single-click "reject all" option for cookies in Europe after France's data protection agency fined Google €150 million for confusing language in cookie banners. The option's rollout began from Google-owned YouTube in France and will soon be expanded across Europe on Google's search engine and YouTube. Cookies help websites keep track of a user's visits and activities.

57.title: It's everybody's dream to direct Big B, you can't talk about him casually: Ajay
57.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn said that it is everybody's dream to direct actor Amitabh Bachchan. "His kind of performance, the kind of dedication he puts in, is worthwhile. He's director's actor. He inspires you completely. He is someone you cannot talk about casually. He is a legend," he said, adding, "I have known him...since childhood...there wasn't any pressure [while directing him]."

58.title: Manish Sisodia inaugurates south Delhi's Ashram underpass
58.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Sunday inaugurated the Ashram underpass in south Delhi. Sisodia said the underpass will not only save commuters' time, but also save nearly 1,550 litres of fuel and 3,600 kg of carbon emissions daily. The four-lane, 750-metre-long underpass connects Nizamuddin with New Friends Colony and aims at providing a signal-free ride between Nizamuddin and Badarpur.

59.title: Police to take action against those found guilty: Maha HM over 'attack' on Somaiya
59.article_body: Maharashtra Home Minister Dilip Walse Patil on Sunday said that a probe is underway into the alleged attack on BJP leader Kirit Somaiya by Shiv Sena workers. "It's true there was stone-pelting…Police will take appropriate action against those found guilty. A case has been registered in the matter," Patil added. Somaiya alleged that Shiv Sena "gundas" assaulted him with stones.

60.title: India has suspended Chinese nationals' tourist visas: Global airlines body
60.article_body: The Indian government has suspended tourist visas issued to Chinese nationals, global airlines body IATA had told its members on April 20. This came after China refused to allow around 22,000 Indian students enrolled in Chinese universities to enter, despite India's appeals. India has requested China to take a "congenial stance" on the issue, MEA spokesperson Arindam Bagchi had said.

61.title: Stayed in a very small room with owner's dog for 9 months: Actress Pia on struggling days
61.article_body: Talking about her struggling days, actress Pia Bajpiee revealed when she came to Mumbai, she couldn't get a place to stay initially. "The owner of an apartment...asked me if I was ready to manage in a very small room where she used to keep her dog," Pia added. She stated, "I stayed there for over nine months with that dog."

62.title: PM Modi inaugurates developmental projects worth over ₹20,000 crore in J&K
62.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, during his visit to Palli village of Jammu and Kashmir's Samba, inaugurated several developmental projects worth over ₹20,000 crore in the Union Territory. The PM laid the foundation stone of Delhi-Amritsar-Katra Expressway and inaugurated a 500 kW solar power plant, along with 108 Jan Aushadhi Kendras. "Our aim is to provide all-weather connectivity to J&K," he said.

63.title: We've same choices: Sayani on twinning with Tamannaah Bhatia at an Iftaar party
63.article_body: Recalling her experience of co-incidentally twinning with actress Tamannaah Bhatia at an Iftaar party, actress Sayani Gupta said, "When we saw that we were wearing the same outfit, it actually added to the fun and joy of meeting each other." "We both were happy that we've...same choices and aesthetics. And our chat wasn't about what we were wearing," she added.

64.title: Be it democracy or development, J&K is setting example: PM Modi
64.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday hailed the development work done in Jammu and Kashmir in the last two to three years. "Be it democracy or development, today Jammu and Kashmir is setting a new example," Modi said, addressing the public in Jammu on National Panchayati Raj Day. Many private investors are interested in coming to J&K, he added.

65.title: Chanting Hanuman Chalisa in Shiv Sena-ruled Maha is a crime: CT Ravi
65.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party leader CT Ravi took to Twitter to say that it is a crime to chant Hanuman Chalisa in Shiv Sena-ruled Maharashtra. "People will be arrested for this crime by Uddhav Thackeray's police. Who said that Aurangzeb is dead!" he wrote. His tweet came after arrest of MP Navneet Rana and her MLA husband Ravi Rana.

66.title: Tour boat hits 'whale', leaps out of water in Mexico; 6 injured
66.article_body: At least six people, including three children, were injured after a tour boat hit something and leapt out of the water in the coastal city of La Paz in Mexico's Baja California Sur, authorities said on Saturday. The authorities added that the boat reportedly hit a whale or a whale shark. A video of the incident was also shared online.

67.title: PM's 'Mann Ki Baat' to be shown every last Sunday at Gandhi Darshan: Vijay Goel
67.article_body: PM Narendra Modi’s monthly radio programme 'Mann Ki Baat' will be shown every last Sunday of the month at Gandhi Darshan in Delhi’s Raj Ghat, Vice-Chairman, Gandhi Smriti, Vijay Goel, said on Saturday. "Tomorrow (Sunday), more than 1,000 residents of slums will come to Gandhi Darshan to watch this programme," Goel tweeted.

68.title: We keep talking about the way we need to play: Abhishek on batting with Kane
68.article_body: SRH's 21-year-old opener Abhishek Sharma, who has scored 220 runs in seven games this IPL season so far, has revealed that captain Kane Williamson talks to him on almost every ball while batting about the way they need to play the game. "Learning a lot from [batting coach] Brian Lara," he added. Abhishek scored 47(28) against RCB on Saturday.

69.title: 4 men arrested for murder of BJP worker in Delhi's Mayur Vihar Phase 3
69.article_body: Days after a BJP worker was shot dead outside his house in Delhi's Mayur Vihar Phase 3, police said they have arrested four men in connection with the crime based on CCTV footage. According to police, the accused, who lived near the victim's house, wanted to take revenge on him. The victim's body was found with five bullet wounds.

70.title: I haven't understood who won what in Takeshi’s Castle till today: Jaaved Jaaferi
70.article_body: Actor Jaaved Jaaferi said till today, he has not understood who won what in the show 'Takeshi's Castle'. "A lot of people...an entire generation grew up on Takeshi's Castle...They want me to do this show. There is...relationship with the show...I would love to do it," he said, adding, "When I meet people...they thank me for bringing that show to them."

71.title: Lucky to be your baby sister: Bella shares childhood pics with Gigi on b'day
71.article_body: American model Bella Hadid on Saturday wished her sister-model Gigi Hadid on her 27th birthday. Sharing a few childhood pictures on her Instagram handle, Bella wrote, "Thank you for being born so that I could be born that was very sweet of you." "Thank you for being...best sister, mom, daughter...ever...I feel so lucky to be your baby sister," she added.

72.title: 9 of 26 onboard missing Japan boat found unconscious: Coast guard
72.article_body: Nine of the 26 people, including two children and two crew members, onboard a sightseeing boat that went missing off the coast of Japan have been found unconscious on Sunday, a coast guard official told Reuters. The official said that it wasn't immediately clear if the people had vital signs. The nine people were reportedly taken to a hospital.

73.title: MS Dhoni, teammates dance during Conway's pre-wedding party, CSK share video
73.article_body: CSK took to social media to share a video of their players dancing during batter Devon Conway's pre-wedding party. The video also features MS Dhoni dancing during the party. All-rounder Dwayne Bravo can be seen doing the dance steps of his song 'Number One' with leg-spinner Prashant Solanki. Conway has left the bio-bubble for his wedding.

74.title: Woman constable carries 86-year-old for 5 km in Gujarat’s Kutch desert
74.article_body: A 27-year-old police constable, Varsha Parmar, lifted an 86-year-old woman on her back and walked for five kilometres under the sun in the white desert of Gujarat's Kutch. The elderly woman had fainted due to sunstroke. Parmar said that she helped the woman for humanity and had no intention of becoming famous after a video of the incident surfaced online.

75.title: Daily COVID-19 cases in Bengaluru rise by 169% in 7 days to 132
75.article_body: The number of daily coronavirus cases in Bengaluru has increased by over 169% in seven days as the city reported 132 cases on Saturday, according to official data. The city had reported 49 new cases on April 17, data showed. The positivity rate in the city on Saturday was 3.4% and the active cases reported were 1,601, data also revealed.

76.title: Charge less money, do more acting: Karan Johar on Varun Dhawan's b'day
76.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar wished Varun Dhawan on his birthday. Sharing a throwback photo featuring himself and Varun where Karan is seen kissing the actor as he held him, he wrote, "Let's get some publicity and wish you as well. Happy Birthday Varun aka Kuku. Live for a thousand years. Create commotion at...box office, charge less money [and] do more acting."

77.title: IAS 2015 topper Tina Dabi shares pic from her wedding with IAS officer Gawande
77.article_body: IAS 2015 topper Tina Dabi took to Twitter to share a new profile picture from her wedding with Dr Pradeep Gawande, a 2013-batch IAS officer. In the photo, the couple can be seen sitting on a couch, while donning a matching white outfit. The duo got married on Wednesday in Rajasthan's capital Jaipur.

78.title: Doctors remove cloth from abdomen of 25-yr-old woman at Thane hospital
78.article_body: Doctors of the Central Hospital in Thane's Ulhasnagar successfully performed a surgery and removed a piece of cloth from the abdomen of a 25-year-old woman. The woman reportedly underwent a maternity surgery at a private hospital in October last year, during which the cloth was left inside her abdomen. A complaint was registered against the private hospital for medical negligence.

79.title: Pradhanmantri Sangrahalaya becoming centre of attraction for youth: PM
79.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday said the recently-inaugurated 'Pradhanmantri Sangrahalaya' is becoming the centre of attraction for the youth, which is connecting them with the precious heritage of the country. "The country has got a Pradhanmantri Sangrahalaya...It's a matter of pride that we are remembering the contribution of PMs," PM Modi added.

80.title: Rape accused out on bail kidnaps victim's brother, blackmails Kota family
80.article_body: Kota Police arrested a 23-year-old rape accused who was out on bail after he kidnapped survivor's minor brother to blackmail family. Police said that accused, Ronak Dhobi told family that their son was in his custody and he would let him go if they withdrew case against him. Dhobi was earlier arrested a year ago for raping boy's elder sister.

81.title: Panchayats are pillars of Indian democracy: PM Modi
81.article_body: On the occasion of National Panchayati Raj Day, PM Narendra Modi on Sunday said the panchayats are the pillars of the Indian democracy. "Wishing you all a very happy National Panchayati Raj Day. Panchayats are the pillars of Indian democracy, in whose strength lies the prosperity of the new India," PM Modi tweeted.

82.title: Man stabs TN Police sub-inspector over month-old fine for drunk driving
82.article_body: A female Tamil Nadu Police sub-inspector was injured after she was stabbed by a man while on duty in Tirunelveli. Police reportedly claimed the accused was enraged as the sub-inspector had booked him one month ago for drunk driving. The accused has been arrested, CM MK Stalin said, adding that he has ordered a high-quality medical treatment for the sub-inspector.

83.title: It's the best spell I've bowled with white ball so far: Jansen on 3/25 vs RCB
83.article_body: SRH pacer Marco Jansen has said that his spell against RCB on Saturday was his best with the white ball so far. Jansen dismissed Faf Du Plessis, Virat Kohli and Anuj Rawat in his first over to reduce RCB to 8/3 after two overs in their match. "I enjoyed the third wicket the most (Anuj Rawat's wicket)," he stated.

84.title: Want Asian countries to change attitude towards Ukraine: Zelenskyy
84.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said that he wanted the Asian countries, many of which haven't voted against Russia's attack on various global platforms, to change their attitude. Stating that the European countries first underestimated Ukraine but their attitude changed later, Zelenskyy added, "I very much want the Asian countries to change their attitude to Ukraine as well."

85.title: Voting underway in France to elect new President
85.article_body: Voting is underway on Sunday to elect the new President of France. The contest is between the incumbent, Emmanuel Macron, and candidate Marine Le Pen, after they emerged as the top two contenders in the first round of election held earlier this month. Polling started at 8 am and will continue till 8 pm, as per local time.

86.title: Hindi is no more a national language: Kiccha Sudeep on KGF 2's success
86.article_body: While referring to the success of 'KGF 2', Kannada actor Kiccha Sudeep, in a video, said, "[People say] a pan-India film was made in Kannada...I'd like to make a small correction." He added, "Hindi is no more a national language...They (Bollywood) are doing pan-India films today. They are struggling [to find success] by dubbing in [other languages]...but it’s not happening."

87.title: Centre to mint ₹100 coin to mark Delhi University's centenary year
87.article_body: The Finance Ministry's Economic Affairs Department has issued a gazette notification announcing the minting of a ₹100 coin to commemorate Delhi University's centenary year. The coin will be composed of an alloy containing 50% silver, according to the notification. One coin face will bear the university's logo while the other will have the Lion Capital of Ashoka Pillar, it said.

88.title: Pune policeman sexually assaults woman he met online, shoots her nude videos
88.article_body: Pune Police have arrested a 34-year-old policeman, Vikram Ganpat Fadtare, for sexually assaulting a 30-year-old married woman whom he met on social media. Fadtare allegedly forced the woman to have sexual intercourse with him and shot nude pictures and videos of her with which he used to threaten her. The crime allegedly occurred between September 2021 and February 2022.

89.title: Kerala officials keen to implement our education model in their state: AAP's Atishi
89.article_body: Educationists and dignitaries from Kerala visited a government school in Delhi’s Kalkaji on Saturday to observe the education system there. They were hosted by Kalkaji MLA and AAP leader Atishi. "It was wonderful to host officials from Kerala at one of our schools in Kalkaji. They were keen to understand and implement our education model in their state," Atishi tweeted.

90.title: Not reached wave but hospitalisations lower than Dec-Jan: Delhi official
90.article_body: A senior health official in national capital Delhi said hospital admissions were low during the Omicron wave in December and January and that they are even lower now. "The patients who are in hospitals are those...whose medical condition even without Covid was critical and those...who have died of infection are also those who had serious co-morbid conditions," the official said.

91.title: 'Never Back Down: Revolt' actress Nitu meets Bihar CM Nitish Kumar
91.article_body: Actress Nitu Chandra Srivastava, who made her Hollywood debut last year with 'Never Back Down: Revolt', recently met Bihar CM Nitish Kumar and Minister of Industries Syed Shahnawaz Hussain on a two-day trip to the state. Sharing pictures from his meeting with Nitu, Nitish Kumar wrote, "I congratulated...her...for her performance in a Hollywood film. Wishing Nitu Chandra a bright future."

92.title: Can't address Salman Khan by his name; for me, he'll always be 'sir': Shehnaaz
92.article_body: Actress and ex 'Bigg Boss 13' contestant Shehnaaz Gill said that she likes Salman Khan's confidence and is fascinated by the actor's way to handle situations. Shehnaaz further said that she can never address Salman Khan by his name, and she will always call him "Sir". Salman and Shehnaaz were recently spotted at Baba Siddique's Iftaar party.

93.title: Happy to spend this b'day working, feels great to be up at 5:30 am: Varun
93.article_body: Varun Dhawan, who turned 35 on Sunday, wrote on Instagram, "It ain't my sweet 16, but super happy to spend this birthday working." "The last two birthdays were spent at home but feels great to be out here on set getting up at 5:30 in morning and reporting to Nitesh Tiwari," he added. Varun is shooting for Nitesh's 'Bawaal'.

94.title: 175 arrested over communal clashes in MP's Khargone; curfew relaxed for 9 hrs
94.article_body: A total of 175 people have been arrested so far over communal clashes that took place in Madhya Pradesh's Khargone during Ram Navami celebrations, police said. Local administration relaxed the curfew in Khargone for nine hours – from 8 am to 5 pm – for the second day in a row on Sunday, while night curfew continues to remain imposed.

95.title: Struggled for 15 months; didn't want dad to risk his earnings on my career: Vivek
95.article_body: Speaking about his journey, actor Vivek Oberoi said he struggled for 15 months to make his own mark in Bollywood. Vivek said he went to producers for auditions and stood outside their doors. "I...dropped my last name as I didn't want to use my father's (Suresh Oberoi) name." "I didn't want...dad to [risk] his lifetime's earnings....on my career," he added.

96.title: Not thinking about India comeback, my focus on IPL: Hardik Pandya
96.article_body: Gujarat Titans captain Hardik Pandya, who's currently the second-highest scorer in the ongoing IPL season, has said he's not thinking about his Team India comeback. "At the moment, I'm playing IPL and will focus on IPL, then will see where the future takes," he added. GT are at the top of IPL points table with six wins in seven games.

97.title: MVA govt propagating violence in front of police: Maharashtra BJP chief
97.article_body: After BJP leader Kirit Somaiya claimed that Shiv Sena’s "gundas" assaulted him with stones in presence of police persons, Maharashtra BJP chief Chandrakant Patil stated that now the MVA government is propagating violence in front of police. "The attack on Kirit Somaiya was not just an attempt to threaten him but to kill him," Patil added.

98.title: 40-yr-old farmer dies by suicide in Punjab; 14th such death in state in April
98.article_body: Depressed over low wheat yield, a 40-year-old farmer allegedly died by suicide in Punjab's Hoshiarpur, police said. Punjab has witnessed 14 farmer suicides in April this year, according to a farmers' union. Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu criticised AAP over its pre-poll promise that no farmer in Punjab would die by suicide due to crop failure after April 1.

99.title: Virat is doing everything that is under his control: RCB coach Bangar
99.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli's form after he recorded his second straight golden duck, RCB head coach Sanjay Bangar said the 33-year-old is doing "everything that is under his control". He added, "But then you have an odd run-out or the first edge that finds his bat lands in fielder's hands." Kohli hasn't crossed the 50-run mark in the ongoing season.

100.title: Sachin batted just once on b'day in 24-yr-long int'l career, hit a century on it
100.article_body: Cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar, who turned 49 on Sunday, batted for India on his birthday only once in his 24-year-long career. He scored 134(131) to help India win the ODI tri-series final against Australia in Sharjah on April 24, 1998. "I was tired but I had to give a gift to wife on my birthday," said Sachin after the final.

101.title: Saw Dhoni getting frustrated only once, he kicked his bag a tiny bit: Shane Watson
101.article_body: DC assistant coach Shane Watson said he has seen his ex-CSK teammate MS Dhoni getting frustrated only once when CSK lost to MI in IPL 2019 final. "I saw him halfway kick his bag a little bit...just a tiny bit. You could see how much it meant to him," he added. "No matter what the situation is...he's calm," Watson stated.

102.title: Money does funny things, it may have poisoned my relationship with Clarke: Symonds
102.article_body: Opening up on the breakdown of his relationship with Michael Clarke, ex-Australia all-rounder Andrew Symonds suggested that Clarke might have become jealous when he became the most expensive overseas player at the inaugural IPL auction. "Money does funny things. It’s a good thing, but it can be a poison and I reckon it may have poisoned our relationship," Symonds said.

103.title: Ola Electric recalls 1,441 electric 2-wheelers amid incidents of EVs catching fire
103.article_body: Ola Electric is recalling 1,441 units of its electric two-wheelers in the wake of incidents of vehicles catching fire. The company said its investigation into the fire incident on March 26 in Pune is ongoing. Recently, there have been several incidents of electric two-wheelers catching fire in various parts of the country forcing manufacturers to recall their vehicles.

104.title: 1 dead, many missing after boat carrying 60 capsizes off Lebanon
104.article_body: One girl was confirmed dead and several others went missing after a boat carrying 60 migrants capsized off the Lebanese coast, said authorities. Lebanon's Transportation Minister Ali Hamie said that 45 people have been rescued and the girl's body has been brought to the shore. The search for the remaining persons is underway, he added.

105.title: US woman falls into vault toilet while trying to get phone, rescued
105.article_body: A woman was rescued by firefighters after she fell into a vault toilet at a national park in US' Seattle while she was trying to retrieve her phone, which had also fallen in. The woman had disassembled the toilet and used dog leashes to get her phone, authorities said. A vault toilet has a tank underneath it to hold waste.

106.title: 2 class 9 students out for dip in cold water drown in Punjab canal
106.article_body: Two class 9 students, both aged 15, who had gone to take dip in cold water, drowned in a canal near Gurdwara Flahi Sahib on Ludhiana-Malerkotla road on Saturday. Police said the deceased, Vijay and Ayush, along with their friend Bhupinder, slipped into deep water after losing balance. While locals managed to rescue Bhupinder, Vijay and Ayush were swept away.

107.title: Explosives, detonator found near Chandigarh jail; bomb squad rushed to spot
107.article_body: An explosive device was found abandoned near the rear boundary wall of the high-security Burail jail in Chandigarh, following which police cordoned off the area and Indian Army's bomb disposal squad was rushed to the spot. Police found a small transparent box, a long codex wire, a small object believed to be a detonator and around 250 grams of explosives.

108.title: Told Alia to do Udta Punjab, director wasn't convinced she could do it: Shahid
108.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor said that he had sent the script of 'Udta Punjab' to actress Alia Bhatt. "I told her that 'you should do this role' and the director was not convinced that she could do it because she has fair skin and she is city-ish kind of girl so he thought she's not right for the character," he added.

109.title: HC denies child custody to man accused of abetting wife's suicide
109.article_body: Punjab and Haryana High Court has denied child custody to a father who is accused of abetting his wife's suicide. The bench observed that the crime would "emotionally devastate and destruct the growing years of the minor [and] will completely compromise her...mental growth". The man had claimed that his three-year-old daughter had been taken away illegally by her maternal grandparents.

110.title: KKR can't be dependent on Andre Russell all the time: Parthiv Patel
110.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Parthiv Patel said KKR can't be dependent on Andre Russell to finish the games for them all the time. "It's going to be very difficult if you're depending on your number seven...even when you are chasing [157 runs]," added Parthiv. Russell got out in the final over when KKR needed 12 off 5 balls to win against GT.

111.title: COVID-19 was 3rd leading cause of death in US in 2021: CDC
111.article_body: COVID-19 was the third leading cause of death in US in 2021 for a second straight year, said the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). The infection was responsible for approximately 4.6 lakh deaths in the country, which was about 60,000 higher than the previous year. The two leading causes of death were heart diseases and cancer.

112.title: Ranas’ arrest display of arrogance of power: Devendra Fadnavis
112.article_body: Following Amravati MP Navneet Rana and her husband MLA Ravi Rana's arrest on Saturday, BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis said that power has gone to the head of the state government. "The Ranas had come to Mumbai to recite Hanuman Chalisa. The state government’s act is a display of arrogance. It shows power has gone to its head," Fadnavis added.

113.title: Manipur media to boycott state govt, BJP news over unpaid ad dues
113.article_body: The media outlets in Manipur have decided to boycott news related to the state government and BJP unit over their respective unpaid advertisement dues from today, according to a joint statement by the state publishers and journalists' unions. Earlier, media outlets had threatened to boycott the state government, BJP unit and Congress unit if dues aren't paid by April 23.

114.title: Indian pharma should focus on global market: Mansukh Mandaviya
114.article_body: Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya said the pandemic taught India’s pharma industry to become self-reliant but there is a need to focus on innovations so that the sector grows and captures the global market. "We identified several Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients and started their manufacturing in the country. We now must look forward to be agile against the global competition," Mandaviya added.

115.title: Will reacted to his wife giving him the side-eye: Chris Rock's mother on Oscar slap
115.article_body: Speaking on Will Smith slapping her son Chris Rock at the Oscars, author Rose Rock said, "You reacted to your wife giving you the side-eye, and you went up, and you made her day because she was bowled over laughing when it happened." The incident happened when Chris Rock made a joke about Smith's wife Jada Pinkett Smith's shaved head.

116.title: My bungalow is very expensive, couldn't be built by doing 4-5 commercial films: Nawazuddin
116.article_body: On being asked whether working in commercial films helped him built his new bungalow 'Nawab', actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui said, "My bungalow is very expensive. It couldn't have been built by just doing four-five commercial films." He further said, "There are some films I have done for free and I will continue to do this, if I believe in them."

117.title: Will be appropriate if Kejriwal uses decent language: Jairam Thakur
117.article_body: Chief Minister of Himachal Pradesh, Jairam Thakur, said that it will be appropriate if Aam Aadmi Party chief Arvind Kejriwal uses "decent language" in the state. "Kejriwal came to Mandi [for first time]...and went back without saying much...People of Himachal are patient listeners...they don't react much," he said. "Jairam is taking...leaf from the AAP's book," Kejriwal had said.

118.title: He really slapped me: Chris Rock's mother on Will Smith slapping her son
118.article_body: Speaking on Will Smith slapping her son Chris Rock at Oscars, author Rose Rock said, "When Will slapped Chris, he slapped all of us, but he really slapped me. When you hurt my child, you hurt me." She added, "I feel really bad he never apologised. His people wrote up a piece...but something like that is personal. You reach out."

119.title: Was nervous, had a thousand questions: Yami on starting Hindi film career at 23
119.article_body: Yami Gautam, who began her journey in Hindi film industry at the age of 23, said, "When I came to...city, I was...nervous and had a thousand questions." The actress, however, added that despite venturing into an "unknown territory", she wasn't scared. "It all comes down to being yourself, being fearless about your choices, and just going for it," said Yami.

120.title: You made me cry like a baby: Ananya on Shahid's performance in 'Jersey'
120.article_body: Ananya Panday took to her Instagram Stories to share a post appreciating Shahid Kapoor's performance in his latest release 'Jersey'. "You made me cry like a baby!!! Just the best," she wrote. Ananya also tagged Mrunal Thakur and wrote, "You're sunshine girl." Directed by Gowtam Tinnanuri, it's a remake of Telugu film 'Jersey', which featured Nani in the lead role.

121.title: UP woman's head tonsured by husband, in-laws as she refuses to leave home
121.article_body: A 40-year-old woman's head was allegedly tonsured after she was physically assaulted by her husband and in-laws in Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh. Her hands and legs were also allegedly tied and she was locked inside a room for two days. The incident allegedly took place when she refused to leave the house, which was constructed with financial assistance of her brother.

122.title: 3 RTO officials suspended after child died in Ghaziabad bus mishap
122.article_body: The UP government has suspended three RTO officials over negligence after a 10-year-old student hit his head on a pole while looking out of the school bus window and died in Ghaziabad's Modinagar. The government action comes after it was found that the bus was running without a fitness certificate and was blacklisted.

123.title: Gained invincible power: N Korea's media ahead of military holiday
123.article_body: North Korea's state media on Sunday claimed that the country has gained "invincible power that the world cannot ignore and no one can touch" under its leader Kim Jong-un. This comes ahead of the 90th anniversary of the founding of the Korean People's Revolutionary Army. Earlier this month, the country claimed that it had tested a new guided weapons system.

124.title: AAP claims Centre plans to demolish Delhi temple, holds protest
124.article_body: AAP on Saturday claimed that the BJP-run central government is planning to demolish Neelkanth Mahadev temple in Delhi's Sriniwaspuri and shared a purported notice by the Housing and Urban Affairs Ministry regarding the same. The party workers, including AAP MLA Atishi, also staged a protest there. "AAP won't allow bulldozers to run over a single temple in Delhi," Atishi said.

125.title: People say 'Don't you advise your son, tell him to do commercial films': Anil
125.article_body: Actor Anil Kapoor said that it is difficult to make people understand when they ask him if he does not advise son Harsh Varrdhan and say he should tell Harsh to do more commercial films. "I say, 'He'll do...when he simply feels...he wants to do it...I don't want to tell him 'you do this...you do that, or anything'," Anil added.

126.title: India reports 2,593 new COVID-19 cases, 44 deaths in 24 hours
126.article_body: India has reported 2,593 COVID-19 cases, 1,755 recoveries and 44 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,527 COVID-19 cases and 33 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 15,873, while the death toll rose to 5,22,193.

127.title: Want to pay for my brother's education & grandparents' medical bills: Palak
127.article_body: Actress Shweta Tiwari's daughter Palak Tiwari said she wishes to help her mother with the family's expenses. "My mom has always been a sole earner, and I want to take that pressure off her back," she added. Palak said she wants to earn enough so that she can provide for her brother's education and pay for her grandparents' medical bills.

128.title: Delhi BJP to ask AAP govt to rename 40 villages
128.article_body: Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta on Saturday said that the party would ask the Aam Aadmi Party-led government to change the names of 40 villages, which "are a symbol of slavery", in the national capital. The villages include Hauz Khas, Masoodpur, Zamrudpur, Humayunpur, Begumpur, Yusuf Sarai and Fatehpur Beri, according to BJP members.

129.title: Explosion heard in Jammu village hours ahead of PM Modi's visit to J&K
129.article_body: An explosion was purportedly heard on Sunday early morning in Jammu's Bishnah village, hours ahead of PM Narendra Modi's visit to Jammu and Kashmir. A senior police officer said a small crater was formed in agricultural fields following the explosion. Local villagers claimed the blast-like sound may have been caused either by lightning or a small meteorite-like object, he added.

130.title: We shouldn't have lost so many wickets in first 5 overs vs SRH: Du Plessis
130.article_body: Talking about their nine-wicket defeat against SRH, RCB captain Faf Du Plessis said they need to find a way to set the foundation while batting in the powerplay in their upcoming games. "The first [five] overs, we shouldn't have lost so many wickets...We just needed to get through that phase," he added. RCB lost four wickets in first five overs.

131.title: Which batters have hit the biggest sixes in IPL 2022 at halfway mark?
131.article_body: MI's 18-year-old batter Dewald Brevis has hit the biggest six of IPL 2022 so far, which has a distance of 112 metres. PBKS' Liam Livingstone hit the second-biggest six (108 metres) of IPL 2022 so far against CSK's Mukesh Choudhary. RR's Jos Buttler is on the third position with a 107-metre six against DC's Shardul Thakur.

132.title: Boria Majumdar found guilty of intimidating Saha, faces 2-year ban by BCCI: Report
132.article_body: Journalist Boria Majumdar has been found guilty by a three-member BCCI committee of intimidating wicketkeeper Wriddhiman Saha over an interview request, The Indian Express reported. BCCI is likely to impose a two-year ban on Boria and it will also write to ICC to blacklist the journalist. Majumdar had sent threatening texts to Saha, which were publicly shared by the latter.

133.title: Forced to buy ₹2-cr painting from Priyanka, money used for Sonia's treatment: Rana Kapoor
133.article_body: Yes Bank co-founder Rana Kapoor has told Enforcement Directorate he was "forced" to buy an MF Husain painting from Priyanka Gandhi for ₹2 crore. He added that the sale proceeds were utilised by Gandhi family for the medical treatment of Congress President Sonia Gandhi in New York. It was revealed in the chargesheet filed by ED in a special court.

134.title: If you try to help, you just get in the way: Vettori on Kohli's form
134.article_body: Ex-RCB captain Daniel Vettori, on being asked if Virat Kohli needed some help, said, "It's easier just to say, 'Virat, we trust you completely'." Vettori added, "If you try to help, you just get in the way and you'll probably say the wrong thing and alienate him." Kohli registered his second straight golden duck in IPL 2022 on Saturday.

135.title: If Ravan offers CM's post to Shiv Sena they will go with him also: Union Minister
135.article_body: Union Minister Narayan Rane said that the Shiv Sena would go "wherever there is power and money". "Shiv Sena leaders can go with anyone. If Ravan comes and offers them the CM post for five years then they will go with him also," Rane added. His remarks came amid the ongoing loudspeaker issue in Maharashtra.

136.title: Having Arjun Bhaiya & Anshula Didi made us secure; I feel more wholesome: Janhvi
136.article_body: When asked how it feels like to have gained two elder siblings, Arjun Kapoor and Anshula Kapoor at such a later stage in life, actress Janhvi Kapoor said, "Having Arjun Bhaiya and Anshula Didi as...part of our lives...made us more secure and stronger." "I feel more wholesome. At a later stage in life, we got two more siblings," she added.

137.title: Police arrests 5 gangsters from Ludhiana mall, nearby area
137.article_body: Police nabbed four gangsters from Ludhiana’s Pavilion Mall on Saturday evening while one of the gang members was nabbed from a nearby filling station. The gang had allegedly opened fire outside a house in Ferozepur on Friday, following which they had landed on the police radar. The gang had escaped after the incident and reached the shopping mall on Saturday.

138.title: Amit Shah failed to protect Delhi from communal riots: Sharad Pawar
138.article_body: Speaking about the Jahangirpuri violence in Delhi, NCP chief Sharad Pawar said that Union Home Minister Amit Shah "failed" to protect the national capital from communal riots. "Amit Shah should have taken steps to keep Delhi unified and undivided but he failed to do so. You have power but you can't even handle a city like Delhi," Pawar added.

139.title: My bungalow is very expensive, couldn't be made by doing 4-5 films: Nawazuddin
139.article_body: Actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui said his bungalow is very expensive and it couldn't have been made by doing four-five films. "There are some films...I've done for free, though, and I will continue to do this...if I believe in them," he added. He also said there are meaningful commercial films like 'Bajrangi Bhaijaan'. "That's...film that makes you think...It unites people," he added.

140.title: Spent two nights at railway station alone: 'Lost' actor Pia on struggling days
140.article_body: Actress Pia Bajpiee, who'll be seen in filmmaker Aniruddha Roy Chowdhury's 'Lost', spoke about the initial struggling days when she came to Mumbai. She said, "It was tough for me to come to Mumbai. I spent two nights at...Delhi railway station because I had no idea how to reach Mumbai." "I didn't get a place to stay," she added.

141.title: Man says he's tensed after losing 'dream phone', tags Hyderabad Police
141.article_body: A Twitter user tagged the Hyderabad Police in his tweet, claiming that he has lost his “dream phone” iPhone 13. “I got that phone after hardships and efforts...Losing it within 15 days is horrible and [I am] tensed...Please help @KTRTRS @MinisterKTR @KTRoffice @hydcitypolice,” he wrote. Hyderabad Police asked him where he lives.

142.title: Philips introduces ThermoProtect Straightener to prevent heat damage
142.article_body: Philips has introduced the new Philips ThermoProtect Hair Straightener equipped with SilkProCare+ ThermoProtect technology to distribute heat evenly across the plates. The brand revealed the keratin-infused ceramic plates come with multiple temperature settings to reduce up to 30% of hair damage. It provides smooth and frizz-free hair with vibrant shine, making it the right choice, it added

143.title: Who are the highest run-scorers in IPL 2022 at halfway stage?
143.article_body: RR opener Jos Buttler, who has slammed three hundreds in IPL 2022, leads the batting charts in the tournament at halfway stage, with 491 runs in seven innings. GT captain Hardik Pandya is the second highest run-getter till now with 295 runs. LSG captain KL Rahul, who was the Orange Cap winner in IPL 2020, is third on the list.

144.title: Veteran Malayalam screenwriter John Paul passes away at 71
144.article_body: Veteran screenwriter John Paul passed away aged 71 at a private hospital in Kochi on Saturday. As per reports, he wasn't keeping well for the last several months. John worked in the Malayalam film industry and had written nearly 100 films. He was known for writing screenplay for movies like 'Chamaram', 'Marmaram', 'Sandhya Mayangum Neram' and others.

145.title: Gangster involved in shootout at Delhi's GTB Hospital escapes from custody
145.article_body: Local gangster Mohit Badani, who along with his associates allegedly helped gangster Kuldeep Fajja escape from police custody at Delhi's GTB Hospital last year by opening fire, managed to escape from police custody at the Karkardooma court. Police claimed Badani is a member of the Gogi-Bishnoi gang and is allegedly involved in several cases, including murder, armed robbery and carjacking.

146.title: Thieves make hole in Pune mobile shop's wall, steal ₹52 lakh-items
146.article_body: A case has been filed after thieves allegedly made a hole in the wall of a mobile phone shop in Pune's Somwar Peth and stole 307 mobile phones along with other items. The stolen items are worth over ₹52 lakh, according to the police. The case was registered under Sections 454, 457 and 380 of the Indian Penal Code.

147.title: 21 on their way to wedding function injured as mini-truck overturns in Thane
147.article_body: At least 21 passengers, who were on their way to a wedding function in a mini-truck, sustained injuries when the vehicle overturned in Thane's Shahapur. "The mini-truck's driver was drinking water while driving when the bottle fell from his hand and went below the tyre. He applied the brake to stop the mini-truck but it overturned," a police officer said.

148.title: Asked to wash utensils, man kills roommate in Pune; arrested
148.article_body: A 21-year-old man allegedly killed his 28-year-old roommate after the latter asked him to wash the utensils late at night on Friday in Pune. The accused was arrested after their third roommate reported the incident to the police. According to police, the accused got enraged and attacked the victim with a kitchen knife, inflicting deep wounds under the chest.

149.title: B'luru CCB bust LPG cylinder refilling racket, seize gas cylinders
149.article_body: The Central Crime Branch (CCB) of Bengaluru police have busted an illegal LPG cylinder refilling racket following a raid at a shed where both government and private gas cylinders were found stockpiled, the city's Joint Commissioner of Police (Crime) Raman Gupta tweeted on Saturday. He added that gas cylinders worth ₹7 lakh were also seized. Two people were reportedly arrested.

150.title: Outstanding performance by bowlers: Williamson on restricting RCB to 68 runs
150.article_body: SRH captain Kane Williamson credited his bowlers for their nine-wicket win against RCB on Saturday. "The guys bowled beautifully and we caught well. It was an outstanding performance...Marco Jansen has got the skills to do that, he's a real treat for us," stated Williamson. SRH restricted RCB to 68 runs, which is the lowest total in IPL 2022 so far.

151.title: Sidharth Malhotra and Kiara Advani break up after dating for over 2 years: Reports
151.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra and actress Kiara Advani have broken up after dating for more than two years, reports said. "The couple has stopped meeting each other...The reason behind their separation is best known to them," a source told 'Bollywood Life'. "Their breakup is indeed disheartening," the source further said. Sidharth and Kiara had worked together in 'Shershaah'.

152.title: A day after buying e-bike, Andhra man killed in battery explosion, wife critical
152.article_body: A 40-year-old man, K Siva Kumar, was killed when the battery of the electric bike he bought on Friday exploded causing fire in his bedroom in Andhra Pradesh's Vijayawada city on Saturday. His wife suffered burns and was in a critical condition in a hospital while their two children also suffered from asphyxiation but were stable, police said.

153.title: I'm injured, Sena gundas assaulted me, wanted to kill me: Kirit Somaiya
153.article_body:
Bharatiya Janata Party leader Kirit Somaiya took to Twitter to say that Shiv Sena’s
“gundas” assaulted him with stones and wanted to kill him “in presence [of] 50 police persons, in compound/campus of Khar Police Station”. “I am injured...sitting in my car...Till action against police officials and...mafia Sena gundas is not taken, I will stay in my car,” he wrote.

154.title: Newly married couple, niece die as tree falls on 2-wheeler in Pune
154.article_body: A couple in their 30s, who got married only days ago, was killed in Pune in an accident after a branch of a tree fell on the two-wheeler they were riding. The man's five-year-old niece, who was travelling with them, also died in the incident. The police said that unseasonal rainfall might have caused the branch to fall.

155.title: Anupam Kher gifts rudraksha beads to PM Modi, shares pics
155.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher met PM Narendra Modi and gifted rudraksha beads to him on behalf of his mother Dulari Kher. Sharing pictures on social media, Anupam wrote, "I and Dulari ji will always remember the reverence with which you accepted the rudraksha beads sent by my mother to protect you." Anupam added, "May God always shower his blessings on you."

156.title: Twitter user shares video of crowd at 2 am in B'luru area, tags police
156.article_body: A Twitter user shared video of congested road in Bengaluru's Frazer Town at 2 am. "I have lived in Frazer Town my entire life and...I used to love eating food at Mosque Road during Ramadan...but this year people have gone nuts, Look at crowd at 2 AM @BlrCityPolice," the user wrote. Police said staff has been deployed for traffic management.

157.title: BJP high command to decide on Cabinet expansion, rejig: K'taka CM
157.article_body: Amid rumours about Cabinet expansion or rejig in Karnataka, Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai said that the BJP high command would take a decision. "I will get to know about it only after discussion with the party high command," he said. This comes ahead of the Karnataka Assembly elections next year. There are 29 ministers in the state Cabinet, including Bommai.

158.title: TMC's Mondal skips CBI summons for 6th time in cattle smuggling case
158.article_body: TMC leader Anubrata Mondal on Saturday skipped summons by the CBI in connection with a cattle smuggling case. Mondal, who was discharged from a hospital on Saturday after suffering from breathing issues, cited health as the reason for being unable to appear today. Notably, this is the sixth time he has skipped a summon by the agency.

159.title: ACB arrests two senior officials for accepting bribe in Rajasthan
159.article_body: The Anti Corruption Bureau (ACB) arrested two senior officials in Alwar, Rajasthan, who were caught red-handed accepting a bribe. The officials have been identified as IAS officer Nannumal Pahadia and RAS officer Ashok Sankhla. A sum of ₹5 Lakh was also recovered from the accused. Officials said ₹16 lakh was demanded by the accused in exchange for allowing construction work.

160.title: Couple killed by relatives for 'practising witchcraft' in J'khand
160.article_body: A husband and wife in their 60s were allegedly killed by relatives who suspected them of practising witchcraft in Jharkhand's Gumla district. They were attacked with an axe and sticks when they were in their house, police said. The man's sister-in-law has been arrested and booked under Prevention of Witch (DAAIN) Practices Act while her son's involvement is being probed.

161.title: Unconstitutional: Athawale on MNS chief's warning over loudspeakers
161.article_body: Union Minister Ramdas Athawale on Saturday termed MNS chief Raj Thackeray's stand on loudspeakers as "unconstitutional". Calling Thackeray a "militant leader" Athawale said, "He can put...loudspeaker on temples but can't ask to remove them from mosques." Thackeray threatened to play Hanuman Chalisa on speakers if the state government didn't remove loudspeakers from mosques by May 3.

162.title: 21-yr-old Odisha man beats mother to death over ₹100 to buy liquor
162.article_body: A 21-year-old man allegedly beat his mother to death over money to buy liquor in Odisha's Mayurbhanj district on Friday. The accused demanded ₹100 from his mother and started beating her when she was unable to pay, police said, adding that he later fled from the spot. The body has been sent for post-mortem and police have launched an investigation.

163.title: US warns Solomon Islands of action over security pact with China
163.article_body: The US has warned the Solomon Islands that it will take unspecified action against any steps to establish a permanent Chinese military presence in the Pacific island nation. The warning comes after the Solomon Islands signed a security pact with China this week. There are potential regional security implications of the accord, according to a White House Statement.

164.title: My resignation permanently with Sonia: Raj CM on leadership change rumours
164.article_body: Amid rumours of leadership change in Rajasthan Congress, CM Ashok Gehlot has said that his resignation letter is permanently present with party chief Sonia Gandhi. Gehlot said, "The CM will change when it has to be changed and no one will get to know anything about it." This came after Sachin Pilot met Sonia Gandhi in Delhi on Thursday.

165.title: 3 killed, 9 injured after car collides with truck in MP's Guna
165.article_body: Three people, including two women, were killed and nine others were injured after the car they were travelling in collided with a truck near a toll tax barrier in Madhya Pradesh's Guna district. The crash took place on Friday after the car tried to overtake the truck, police said. The victims were on their way to attend a marriage ceremony.

166.title: 100 killed in explosion at illegal oil refining depot in Nigeria
166.article_body: Over 100 people were killed in an explosion at an illegal oil refining depot in Nigeria's Rivers state, a government official and an NGO said on Saturday. The victims "were burnt beyond recognition", the official added. Notably, unemployment and poverty in the Niger Delta have made illegal crude refining an attractive business but with deadly consequences, according to Reuters.

167.title: Jahangirpuri violence accused was planning to flee Delhi: Police
167.article_body: In the Jahangirpuri violence case, the Delhi Police said that accused Sonu alias Yunus was planning to flee Delhi in a bid to escape arrest. "He was planning to evade arrest and for that, he came out of his hiding to collect money, when police arrested him," the police said. Sonu was arrested for allegedly firing shots during the violence.

168.title: Ripun Bora appointed Trinamool Congress' Assam unit president
168.article_body: West Bengal CM and TMC chief Mamata Banerjee appointed Ripun Bora as the President of the All India Trinamool Congress Assam unit. TMC General Secretary Abhishek Banerjee issued a notice which stated that Mamata Banerjee has appointed Ripun Bora as Assam TMC's President with immediate effect. Ripun Bora left Congress and joined TMC on April 17.

169.title: How does the IPL 2022 points table read at the halfway mark?
169.article_body: At the halfway mark of IPL 2022, GT are on top of the points table with 12 points from seven matches. GT are followed by SRH, RR and RCB, who have 10 points each. Defending champions CSK are ninth with just two victories so far, while five-time champions MI are on the bottom of the points table with seven losses.

170.title: BCCI announce venues for India's five-match T20I series against South Africa
170.article_body: The BCCI on Saturday announced the venues for India's five-match T20I series against South Africa, which will take place in June. The first T20I will take place in Delhi on June 9. The second T20I will take place in Cuttack on June 12. The remaining T20Is will be held in Visakhapatnam (June 14), Rajkot (June 17) and Bengaluru (June 19).

171.title: CCTV footage shows the moment CISF personnel's bus was attacked in J&K
171.article_body: A day after a CISF Assistant Sub-Inspector was killed in a terrorist attack in Jammu and Kashmir, CCTV footage of the moment the attack happened has been released. In the video, the bus carrying 15 CISF personnel can be seen stopping in the middle of the road in Jammu's Sunjwan area. It was then attacked with a grenade and rifles.

172.title: DR Congo declares new Ebola outbreak after detecting 1 case
172.article_body: The Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) on Saturday declared an outbreak of Ebola after a new case of the virus was detected in the country. The virus was detected in a 31-year-old male who died on April 21 in Equateur Province's capital Mbandaka. Around 74 of his contacts are being tracked, the Health Ministry said in a statement.

173.title: Hardik Pandya's wife Nataša Stanković dances to celebrate Narine's wicket, IPL share video
173.article_body: Gujarat Titans (GT) captain Hardik Pandya's wife Nataša Stanković danced in the stands to celebrate GT fast bowler Mohammad Shami taking the wicket of Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) all-rounder Sunil Narine in their IPL 2022 match. Narine was dismissed for five runs off five deliveries. GT went on to defeat KKR by eight runs in the match.

174.title: BNP Paribas trader fired for 'emotional terrorism' against staff sues for $4mn in France
174.article_body: Omar Alami, who was fired from his position as the head of BNP Paribas's equity derivatives sales for Switzerland, Belgium and Luxembourg in 2019, is suing the French bank for $4 million for unfairly dismissing him. The bank's lawyer has said that employees accused Alami of "emotional terrorism" and behaviour that left them with "a feeling of waterboarding".

175.title: Crypto is big part of future, people are looking at it the wrong way: Mark Cuban
175.article_body: Billionaire investor Mark Cuban told Bloomberg that cryptocurrencies are "a big part of the future", but "people are looking at it the wrong way". He explained, "They get really amped up about the price of cryptocurrencies, and...think that's really what crypto is. But that's the noise." Cuban said "the signal" is how crypto can help disrupt an industry.

176.title: Jaish-e-Mohammed militant from Pakistan killed in encounter in J&K
176.article_body: A Pakistani militant of the terrorist group Jaish-e-Mohammed was eliminated in an encounter with the Indian security forces in  Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam, police said.
