Kashmir IGP Vijay Kumar said that the deceased was a Pakistani national, who belonged to the JeM outfit. "One Pakistani terrorist of proscribed terror outfit JeM killed. Operation in progress," he tweeted.

177.title: 3 Pak soldiers killed in cross-border firing by Afghan militants
177.article_body: Three Pakistani soldiers were killed in a cross-border firing by militants from Afghanistan on a Pakistani military post in the North Waziristan district, an official statement said on Saturday. Several militants were killed in retaliatory firing by Pakistani troops, it added. Notably, eight Pakistani soldiers were killed in two terrorist attacks in the same region on April 14.

178.title: PSI recruitment scam will be thoroughly investigated: K'taka CM
178.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai has promised a thorough probe into the Police Sub-Inspector (PSI) recruitment scam. "Everything related to the PSI recruitment scam will be thoroughly investigated and action will be taken against those found guilty," Bommai said. Karnataka CID has arrested 11 people in connection with the case including Congress block president Mahanthesh Patil.

179.title: Limit plastic bottles' use: Punjab health department to officials
179.article_body: The Punjab Directorate of Health and Family Welfare issued an order to its officials, asking its department to limit the use of plastic bottles and bouquets in Health Ministry events to reduce plastic waste. "The step has been taken to reduce plastic waste, pollution and to safeguard the public health," the order stated.

180.title: 4 arrested after BJP leader Jitu Chaudhary shot dead in Delhi
180.article_body: Delhi Police have arrested four people in connection with the murder case of local BJP leader Jitu Chaudhary, Deputy Commissioner of Police East Priyanka Kashyap said on Saturday. The 42-year-old leader was reportedly shot dead around 8:15 pm on Wednesday in Mayur Vihar Phase-3. A police constable found Chaudhary's body in a pool of blood in front of his house.

181.title: Ex-gratia for soldiers killed on duty raised to ₹50 lakh: Assam CM
181.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said that the Assam government will increase the compensation for soldiers killed on duty to ₹50 lakh. "Our government has made efforts to recognise and compensate the sacrifices made by our soldiers by way of offering ₹50 lakh ex-gratia, jobs for next of kin...and reservation of seats for their wards in medical studies," he added.

182.title: Israel closes border crossing to Gaza workers after rocket attacks
182.article_body: Israeli authorities on Saturday said that they would close the border crossing for thousands of workers from the Gaza Strip, a move denounced by Palestinians as "collective punishment". The move comes after a series of rockets were fired from the Palestinian territory in recent days. "The re-opening of the crossing will be decided accordingly with a security assessment," they added.

183.title: SRH defeat RCB with 72 balls to spare, record 5th win in a row
183.article_body: SunRisers Hyderabad (SRH) defeated Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) by nine wickets with 72 balls to spare to register their fifth win in a row in IPL 2022. RCB were dismissed for 68 runs in 16.1 overs, which is the lowest total in IPL 2022 so far. SRH chased down the target in  eight overs, with Abhishek Sharma scoring 47(28).

184.title: Nothing political: Bihar CM Nitish on attending RJD's Iftar party
184.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar, who attended an Iftar party hosted by RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav on Friday, dismissed speculations about changing political equations saying there was "nothing political" behind his decision. He added, "Many people are invited to such Iftar parties. What connection does it have with politics?" Notably, Kumar had last visited former CM Rabri Devi's residence in 2017.

185.title: Woman ends up sitting next to Anushka during Mumbai IPL match, her video goes viral
185.article_body: An Instagram user's video went viral after she ended up sitting next to Anushka Sharma during an IPL match at Mumbai's Wankhede Stadium. Raveena Ahuja posted an Instagram video documenting her experience of watching the match from the corporate box at the stadium. Anushka is even seen posing for Ahuja's video, which has garnered millions of views.

186.title: In these days of instant noodles, people expect instant justice: CJI
186.article_body: Chief Justice of India NV Ramana on Saturday said, "In these days of instant noodles, people expect instant justice. But the people don't realise that real justice will be a casualty if we strive for instant justice." He was at an event in Tamil Nadu to lay the foundation stone for the Administrative Block of Madras High Court.

187.title: BJP MLA's sons booked for assaulting forest guards in MP's Sheopur
187.article_body: The two sons of BJP MLA Sitaram Adivasi have been booked after they were allegedly seen assaulting forest department staff in MP's Sheopur in a viral video. The incident reportedly took place on Thursday when forest guards at Budhera forest range's Piprani post stopped the MLA's sons from illegally mining stones. Police said that both parties have filed a complaint.

188.title: No break for next 6 months: BJP to its workers ahead of Guj polls
188.article_body: BJP workers in Gujarat have been asked to work without a break for the next six months after May 4 to prepare for the upcoming Assembly elections in December, state party chief CR Patil said. He added they'll not be holding any programs from May 1 to 4 and that'll be the "only break...party workers will get" before the polls.

189.title: 77,000 people wave national flag to break Pak's record in Amit Shah's presence
189.article_body: Over 77,000 people waved the national flag together at an event attended by Home Minister Amit Shah in Bihar on Saturday. The BJP sought to make history by breaking Pakistan's record that was set 18 years ago and a video of the same has also been shared online. The event was organised as part of the 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav'.

190.title: Delhi reports over 1,000 COVID-19 cases for 2nd straight day and 2 deaths
190.article_body: Delhi on Saturday reported over 1,000 (1,094) new COVID-19 cases for the second straight day, after seeing 1,042 cases on Friday. Delhi also recorded two COVID-19 related deaths in the last 24 hours, while 640 people recovered from the disease in one day. The city's daily COVID-19 positivity rate is at 4.82%. Delhi now has 3,705 active cases of COVID-19.

191.title: RCB record their 2nd lowest IPL total exactly 5 yrs after recording lowest-ever IPL total
191.article_body: RCB on Saturday recorded their second-lowest total in IPL after being dismissed for 68 runs in 16.1 overs. Only Glenn Maxwell (12) and Suyash Prabhudessai (15) scored more than 10 runs for RCB. Notably, RCB had recorded the lowest-ever total in IPL exactly five years ago on April 23, 2017, when they were bowled out for 49 runs against KKR.

192.title: Aditya Birla Capital appoints Vishakha Mulye as new CEO
192.article_body: Aditya Birla Capital on Saturday said that it has appointed Vishakha Mulye as its new Chief Executive Officer (CEO). The company's present CEO Ajay Srinivasan plans to move out of his current role and take up another role within Aditya Birla Group. Mulye is a chartered accountant by qualification and currently an Executive Director of ICICI Bank, the company said.

193.title: Got similar offers after 'One Two Three Four', took break: Priyamani
193.article_body: Actress Priyamani has revealed that she took a break from the Hindi film industry after her song 'One Two Three Four' in 2013 film 'Chennai Express' because she only got offers for doing similar numbers. She added that she didn't want it to be like that. "If you enter Hindi cinema, you are there. It has a...pan-India audience," Priyamani said.

194.title: Man killed in EV battery explosion in Vijayawada a day after buying e-scooter
194.article_body: A 40-year-old man died and three of his family members were left critically injured after an e-scooter's battery exploded inside their residence in Vijayawada. Siva Kumar had bought the Boom Motors Corbett 14 scooter on Friday and plugged its battery to charge before going to sleep, police said. Kumar died of burns and suffocation while being rushed to the hospital.

195.title: People sold properties, ended up losing everything: Officer who probed Amway fraud
195.article_body: Telangana IPS officer VC Sajjanar who has been looking into Multi-Level Marketing (MLM) frauds by companies like Amway, has said that people who invested in such companies "sold or mortgaged properties". "[They] ended up losing everything," said Sajjanar. Talking about the 'MLM-craze', he said, "Families were being torn apart and the social fabric was breaking."

196.title: IAS officer shares pics of books she read for UPSC preparation, says 'each has its imp'
196.article_body: IAS officer Rajeshwari B has shared pictures of some of her notes and books she studied while preparing for UPSC. The 2011 batch officer tweeted, "Can't claim that I read all these books completely. There are many more books along with these. Some I definitely completed & reread. Some read once...Some referred as per need, so each has its importance."

197.title: Kohli walks entire way back with his head down after 2nd straight duck, IPL share video
197.article_body: RCB batter Virat Kohli got out for his second consecutive golden duck in IPL 2022 today. In a video shared by IPL, Kohli can be seen standing on the pitch with his head down before walking entire way back to the pavilion with his head down. "So disappointing to see Kohli go the whole way [like this]," a fan tweeted.

198.title: Cong, BJP both are responsible: Owaisi on temple demolition in Raj
198.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Saturday said that both the Congress and the BJP are equally responsible for the demolition of 300-year-old Shiva temple in Rajasthan's Alwar. Owaisi said, "I condemn the decision. The Municipality Board was headed by BJP and Congress government accepted the decision to demolish the [Alwar] temple." "They [both] should apologise to the public," he added.

199.title: PM Modi set a target to make India number 1 in world by 2047: Shah
199.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has set a target of making India number one in the world by 2047, Union Home Minister Amit Shah said on Saturday. He made the comment at a function in Bihar. Separately, Shah, in a reference to RJD, said, "Mere avoidance of putting up posters of Lalu Prasad (Yadav) cannot erase...memories of the jungle raj."

200.title: Liquor mafia members surrender after being inspired by UP CM's work
200.article_body: Five people who claimed they were involved in the manufacturing and selling of illicit liquor surrendered at a police station in UP's Shahjahanpur on Friday. The five men carried posters that read, "Influenced by the policies of Yogi Adityanath...I'll never make illicit liquor again [and] that's why I have come to surrender". Four of them are history-sheeters, the police said.

201.title: Tour boat with 26 onboard missing in Japan after distress call
201.article_body: A sightseeing boat carrying 26 people, including two children and two crew members, went missing in waters off Japan on Saturday after sending a distress signal to authorities, according to local media reports. The authorities have launched a search for the boat. Japanese PM Fumio Kishida instructed authorities to use all available means in the search, a local report said.

202.title: GT jump to top of IPL 2022 points table, KKR suffer 4th straight defeat
202.article_body: GT defeated KKR by eight runs in their IPL 2022 match to jump to the top of the points table. GT have now won three matches in a row, while KKR have lost four consecutive matches. GT captain Hardik Pandya top-scored in the match with 67(49), while GT bowlers Mohammad Shami, Yash Dayal and Rashid Khan took two wickets each.

203.title: Indian wrestler Ravi wins hat-trick of Asian Championships golds
203.article_body: Tokyo Olympics silver medallist Ravi Kumar Dahiya won a gold medal in 57kg category at Asian Wrestling Championships in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia, on Saturday and became first Indian wrestler to win three consecutive gold medals at the tournament. Ravi led Kazakhstan's Rakhat Kalzhan 12-2 and won on technical superiority. Notably, India won five medals on day one of men's freestyle bouts.

204.title: Virat Kohli gets out for second golden duck in a row
204.article_body: RCB batter Virat Kohli recorded his second consecutive golden duck in IPL 2022 on Saturday. Kohli was dismissed by SRH fast bowler Marco Jansen after edging a delivery to the slips. Kohli has now been dismissed for a golden duck five times in IPL history. Kohli has been dismissed for four single-digit scores in IPL 2022.

205.title: Affleck denies being on dating app after reality star claims they matched
205.article_body: Actor Ben Affleck has denied being on dating app 'Raya' after reality show 'Selling Sunset' star Emma Hernan claimed they matched. A spokesperson for Ben said, "Raya has confirmed that he has not been an active member for several years." Emma had said on the show that Ben asked her to grab coffee a few times but she didn't go.

206.title: Ola may recall a few batches of e-scooters: CEO after recent fire incident
206.article_body: Ola Electric's Founder and CEO Bhavish Aggarwal said on Saturday that the company may recall a few batches of its electric scooters. He said that Ola has hired "world-class agencies" to find out the root cause behind its scooter catching fire recently. The company might do a recall depending on the recommendations it receives from the agencies, Aggarwal added.

207.title: NASA shares video of solar eclipse on Mars
207.article_body: NASA has shared a video of a solar eclipse featuring Phobos, which is one of the two moons of Mars. "It's the most zoomed-in, highest-frame-rate observation of a Phobos solar eclipse ever taken from the Martian surface," said the American space agency on the now-viral video captured by its Perseverance Mars Rover.

208.title: Will Smith can learn to slap comedians with legal cases in India: Vir Das
208.article_body: Comedian Vir Das on Saturday took to Instagram to welcome actor Will Smith to India with a joke. The comedian wrote, "Will Smith is in India? Good. He can learn to stop slapping comedians with his hands and start slapping them with legal cases." Vir was slapped with legal cases over his 'I Come From 2 Indias' monologue last year.

209.title: India is world no. 2 in most emerging unicorns, ahead of China: Govt
209.article_body: Sharing data on countries with most emerging unicorns, Union Minister Piyush Goyal tweeted, "India is world No. 2, ahead of China among countries with most emerging Unicorns." While US topped the list, China is stated to have 27 emerging unicorns against India's 32. "Our robust & innovative ecosystem is enabling Indian startups to zoom into the Unicorn club," Goyal added.

210.title: Silver items worth over ₹1.25 crore stolen from Maharashtra godown
210.article_body: Silver valuables worth over ₹1.25 crore were reportedly stolen from a godown in Thane, Maharashtra. Police said that the incident occurred during the intervening night of Thursday and Friday in Pagaon village. "Thieves entered the godown and stole silver items worth over ₹1.25 crore. Following a complaint, a dog squad was pressed into service," a police official said.

211.title: All is well: HDFC CEO to shareholders worried about drop in stock price
211.article_body: HDFC CEO Keki Mistry in a message to shareholders worried about the recent drop in the company's stock price said, "All is well." Shares of HDFC and HDFC Bank plunged 18% each after the companies announced their merger earlier this month. Mistry said the fall in stock prices was due to lack of communication on the benefits of the merger.

212.title: Amravati MP & her MLA husband arrested amid Hanuman Chalisa recital row
212.article_body: Amravati MP Navneet Rana and her husband MLA Ravi Rana were arrested on Saturday from their home by Mumbai Police. This came hours after the couple cancelled their plan to recite Hanuman Chalisa outside Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray's residence. They have been booked under section 153 (A) (promoting enmity between different groups on grounds of religion, race etc), police said.

213.title: SRH to bowl first against RCB after winning their 7th toss in a row, teams unchanged
213.article_body: SRH captain Kane Williamson won his seventh consecutive toss in IPL 2022 and elected to bowl first against RCB in their IPL 2022 clash on Saturday. Both the playing XIs are unchanged. RCB are currently third on the points table, while SRH are placed fifth. The match is taking place at the Brabourne Stadium in Mumbai.

214.title: Hyderabad Police Commissioner hosts Iftar party, shares pictures
214.article_body: Hyderabad City Police Commissioner CV Anand hosted a Ramadan Iftar party on Friday. He shared pictures from the Iftar party on Twitter and wrote, "Delighted to share a moment of communion and joy with members of the community, dignitaries and friends during the Hyderabad City Police's Ramadan Iftar." Muslims across the world observe fast during the holy month of Ramadan.

215.title: He's very professional: Mike Hesson on SRH skipper Kane Williamson
215.article_body: Talking about Kane Williamson, who led SRH to four consecutive wins after losing first two matches in the ongoing IPL, RCB Director of Cricket Operations Mike Hesson said the SRH captain is methodical in terms of preparations. "He's very professional. He's obviously brought that team together after a tough start," he stated. SRH will face RCB at Brabourne Stadium today.

216.title: Karthik anticipating bowlers, picking up length early in IPL 2022: Shastri
216.article_body: Praising Dinesh Karthik's batting performance in IPL 2022, Ravi Shastri said the RCB wicketkeeper-batter is moving early and anticipating what the bowler is planning to do. "He's outsmarting the bowlers...he's picking up the length better than most players even younger than him," he added. Karthik is RCB's second-highest run-getter, scoring 210 runs from seven matches so far.

217.title: 95-yr-old woman fights off guard enforcing lockdown in Shanghai, video surfaces
217.article_body: A video has shown a 95-year-old woman fighting off a guard who was enforcing the zero-COVID-19 lockdown in China's Shanghai. The woman, who reportedly tested positive for COVID-19, is seen being stopped by a guard in PPE, using a wooden broom which she's seen grabbing and pushing to fend the guard off. She has reportedly escaped quarantine thrice.

218.title: MI seem to have had their soul ripped out at the mega auction: Kevin Pietersen
218.article_body: Referring to MI losing their first seven matches in IPL 2022, ex-England captain Pietersen said, "Mumbai seem to have had their soul ripped out at the mega auction." He added, "I just can’t understand why MI have weakened their bowling so much by using up a spot on an injured Jofra Archer and letting Trent Boult go elsewhere."

219.title: Society is ageist; if they don't need you, they'll throw you out: Anil
219.article_body: Actor Anil Kapoor has stated that all professions are dictated by an ageist society, adding that it tells you when it's time to hang up your boots. "The world is such that if they don't need you, they will throw you out. In such a scenario, I thank God that I am still doing exciting work," the actor said.

220.title: Rainfall predicted in several states; IMD releases list
220.article_body: IMD has predicted rainfall in Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram, Tripura, West Bengal and Sikkim over the next five days. Isolated to scattered rainfall is predicted in Kerala and Telangana over the next five days and in Andhra Pradesh, Karnataka, Chhattisgarh and Tamil Nadu over the next two days. It's likely over Maharashtra in next 24 hours.

221.title: Kanye West raps about divorce, 'family in danger' in new songs
221.article_body: Rapper Kanye West has rapped about his divorce with ex-wife Kim Kardashian and ongoing custody issues in songs 'Dreamin Of The Past' and 'Rock N Roll'. He raps in 'Rock N Roll', "I ain't come to pick up the kids to pick a fight." In 'Dreamin Of The Past', Kanye sings, "When daddy's not home, the family's in danger."

222.title: Mevani arrested for insulting religious sentiments: Assam Police
222.article_body: Assam Police have said that Gujarat MLA Jignesh Mevani was arrested for allegedly hurting the religious sentiments of a community in his tweets. "Primary offence committed by Jignesh Mevani under IPC 295(a) is insulting the sentiments of religion, through his tweets wherein he equated Nathuram Godse to Devata (God)," police said. The MLA was arrested by Assam Police on Wednesday.

223.title: Iran resumes talks with regional rival Saudi Arabia in Iraq
223.article_body: Iran has resumed talks with its regional rival Saudi Arabia in Iraq's capital Baghdad, the Iranian state media reported on Saturday. Notably, Iran had announced the temporary suspension of the talks a day after Saudi Arabia executed 41 Shi'ite Muslims in March. The talks began last year and are aimed at defusing tensions between the two countries.

224.title: Family focused on deep healing: Jada on Will slapping Chris at Oscars
224.article_body: Actress Jada Pinkett Smith released a statement on her talk show 'Red Table Talk' addressing her husband Will Smith slapping Chris Rock at the 2022 Oscars. It reads, "Considering all that has happened in the last few weeks, the Smith family has been focusing on deep healing. Some of those discoveries around our healing will be shared...when the time calls."

225.title: Hyderabad is called the medical hub of India: TRS MLC K Kavitha
225.article_body: TRS MLC K Kavitha attended the Colon Cancer Awareness initiative by AIG hospital in Hyderabad. Inaugurating the centre dedicated to colorectal cancer patients, she said, "Today, Hyderabad is lauded as the Medical Hub of India. We are very proud of the medical fraternity, who constantly keeps in touch with the latest developments and tries to bring them to Hyderabad."

226.title: Deeply hurt: Ex-Pimpri-Chinchwad Police chief on being transferred
226.article_body: IPS officer Krishna Prakash, who was recently transferred from the post of Pimpri-Chinchwad Police Commissioner, on Saturday said that he's deeply hurt by the sudden transfer. Prakash said that he'll approach the Maharashtra CM and Deputy CM and find the reason behind his transfer. Prakash was transferred to Mumbai as the special inspector general of police (VIP security) on Wednesday.

227.title: Unknown persons vandalise idol at temple in Gurugram; police launch probe
227.article_body: An investigation has been launched after an idol was allegedly vandalised at an ancient Dadi Sati temple in Gurugram's Bhondsi by some unknown persons, police said on Saturday. The miscreants allegedly damaged the idol with a sharp object. Meanwhile, Karni Sena president and Haryana BJP spokesperson, Suraj Pal Ammu, went to the village and alleged a conspiracy behind the incident.

228.title: Video shows Tesla car crashing into $3.5-million private jet in US
228.article_body: A video has surfaced online, showing a Tesla car crashing into a $3.5-million private jet in US' Washington. The car could be seen pushing the Cirrus Vision Jet across the tarmac. The Tesla owner was reportedly using the 'Smart Summon' feature that enables a Tesla vehicle to leave a parking space and navigate around obstacles to reach its owner.

229.title: Actor Ram Charan attends Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav in Hyderabad
229.article_body: Telugu actor Ram Charan attended the Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav organised in Hyderabad on Saturday to celebrate the 75th year of Independence. The actor placed a wreath to commemorate those who sacrificed their lives for the country and celebrated those who continue to do so and gave a speech about the Armed Forces. He also handed out mementos and certificates.

230.title: I've citizen's support: Bhimale on renaming of Pune's Salisbury Park
230.article_body: Amid protests by locals over the renaming of Pune's Salisbury Park garden in the name of his father, ex-BJP corporator Shrinath Bhimale said he won't remove his father's name. Bhimale said, "I've the support of 90% of...people...[They're]...not interested in changing the name." The garden was initially named 'PMC garden', however, its name was changed to Prof Yashwantrao Bhimale Garden later.

231.title: Fast bowler takes 4 wickets in one over for the first time in IPL history
231.article_body: The GT-KKR IPL 2022 match witnessed the first instance of a fast bowler taking four wickets in an over in IPL history. Bowling the 20th over of GT's innings, KKR all-rounder Andre Russell dismissed Abhinav Manohar, Lockie Ferguson, Rahul Tewatia and Yash Dayal. It was Russell's only over of the innings. He recorded figures of 1-0-5-4.

232.title: India won't hesitate to cross borders if targeted from outside: Rajnath Singh
232.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Saturday said that we will not hesitate to cross borders "if the country is targeted from outside". "India has been successful in giving out the message that terrorism will be strongly dealt with," said Singh. He added that the eastern boundary of India is currently more peaceful as compared to the western front.

233.title: Irfan Pathan shares pic of 'Preamble to the Constitution' after Amit Mishra's tweet
233.article_body: Ex-cricketer Irfan Pathan took to social media to share a picture of 'Preamble to the Constitution' after Amit Mishra's apparent reply to his tweet on India's potential to become the greatest country. "My country...has the potential to be the greatest country on earth...only if some people realise that our constitution is the first book to be followed," Mishra had tweeted.

234.title: I regretted not doing it on Shark Tank: Namita as she invests in Agri Tourism
234.article_body: Emcure Pharma's Executive Director Namita Thapar took to Instagram to reveal that she has invested in Pandurang Taware's startup Agri Tourism India. "My two regrets during Shark Tank were Jugaadu Kamlesh & Pandurang Taware, two incredible farmers from Maharashtra. Today I have invested in Pandurang's company," Thapar said. Taware is known as the Father of Agri Tourism Concept in India.

235.title: It was incredible watching him bat vs DC: Padikkal on fellow opener Buttler
235.article_body: RR opener Devdutt Padikkal (54), who formed a 155-run opening wicket partnership with Jos Buttler (116) against DC in ongoing IPL, said it was "incredible" watching the fellow opener bat. "He is playing the best cricket anyone has in IPL. To see him enjoy himself and go after the bowling from ball one is great to watch," he added.

236.title: 5 prime accused of Jahangirpuri violence sent to 8-day police custody
236.article_body: A Delhi court on Saturday sent Jahangirpuri violence's five prime accused, who were charged under stringent National Security Act, to eight-day police custody. These five accused are Ansar, Salim, Dilshad, Sonu and Ahir. Meanwhile, the four other accused have been sent to judicial custody for 14 days. Notably, clashes broke out during a Hanuman Jayanti rally in Jahangirpuri last week.

237.title: Store charges man ₹12 for carry bag, ordered to pay ₹21,000 compensation in Andhra
237.article_body: Visakhapatnam District Consumers Commission in Andhra Pradesh recently ordered a multi-brand clothing retailer to pay ₹21,000 as compensation to a customer for charging ₹12 for a carry bag. It was also ordered to pay ₹1,500 towards legal cost. The store manager had reportedly shouted at the customer after he explained it was illegal to charge for bags advertising the store.

238.title: Last over of match was topsy-turvy vs DC: Ashwin after RR's 15-run win
238.article_body: Following RR's 15-run win against DC in IPL 2022, RR all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin said last over of the match was "topsy-turvy", adding he was having his fingers crossed. With DC needing 36 runs to win in last over, batter Rovman Powell hit three sixes in first three balls and then scored only two before getting out on the final ball.

239.title: Razing of religious places, poor's houses weakens our Constitution: Mayawati
239.article_body: Bahujan Samaj Party chief Mayawati has criticised the demolition of "religious places and residences of the poor" done by state governments of both, the BJP and Congress. "In (Congress-ruled) Rajasthan, demolition of a temple under the guise of encroachment and residences of poor in BJP-ruled state in the name of encroachment is disgusting politics. It weakens our Constitution," Mayawati tweeted.

240.title: What's wrong if Pune's Salisbury Park gets named after my father: Shrinath
240.article_body: In the ongoing protest by a section of residents against the Pune's Salisbury Park being renamed after Late Yashwant Bhimale, his son and former BJP corporator Shrinath has spoken out against the protest. "It (protest) is orchestrated by a handful of people. Besides, my father...worked relentlessly for the citizens...What is wrong if the garden gets my father's name," Shrinath asked.

241.title: Pak reports 1st polio case in 15 months, PM to chair emergency meet
241.article_body: Pakistan's PM Shehbaz Sharif has said that he will chair an emergency meeting of the National Task Force for Polio Eradication after authorities detected the country's first case of the debilitating neurodegenerative disease in 15 months. The case was detected in a 15-month-old boy in Pakistan's North Waziristan, the health officials said. The boy has been paralyzed, they added.

242.title: Ranbir Kapoor, Rashmika Mandanna's first looks from 'Animal' leaked
242.article_body: A video revealing Ranbir Kapoor and Rashmika Mandanna's looks for their upcoming film 'Animal' has gone viral on social media. In the video, which was shot in Himachal Pradesh's Manali, Ranbir can be seen in a white kurta-pyjama, while Rashmika can be seen in a saree. The Sandeep Reddy Vanga directorial will also feature Anil Kapoor and Bobby Deol.

243.title: Kohli has fire in his belly and passion, my team is RCB: Harry Kane
243.article_body: Tottenham Hotspur striker Harry Kane said he supports RCB in IPL, adding that former RCB captain Virat Kohli has "fire in his belly" and passion which is great to see. "Kohli is incredible. [He is] a real down to earth guy," stated Kane. "I have been lucky enough to meet Kohli a few times and speak with him," said Kane.

244.title: Russia claims it shot down Ukrainian fighter jet in Kharkiv region
244.article_body: Russian forces have shot down a Ukrainian Su-25 fighter jet in Ukraine's Kharkiv region, Russia's Defence Ministry said on Saturday. Russian forces have also destroyed three MI-8 helicopters belonging to the Ukrainian forces at an airfield in the region, the ministry added. However, there was no immediate reaction from Ukraine regarding the Russian claims.

245.title: Elon Musk's SpaceX becomes largest employer in a US city
245.article_body: Elon Musk-owned SpaceX is now the "largest private employer" in the US city of Brownsville following an investment of $430 million on operations in 2021, according to a Houston Chronicle report. Brownsville Mayor Trey Mendez said SpaceX expects to contribute $885 million in gross economic output for Cameron County. SpaceX's Boca Chica launch site is located in Cameron County.

246.title: Man makes PowerPoint presentation for lost bag after Irish airline misplaces it
246.article_body: A passenger who was travelling to London after his wedding, placed AirTags in his different baggage in order to track their location. After having lost one bag, he repeatedly contacted the Irish carrier Aer Lingus for it and after not receiving any reply, he made a PowerPoint presentation showing where his bag had travelled to and shared it on Twitter.

247.title: Koratala Siva confirms films with Mahesh Babu, Ram Charan & Allu Arjun
247.article_body: Filmmaker Koratala Siva, known for directing 'Bharat Ane Nenu', spoke about his upcoming projects and said, "I have one film that will be with Mahesh Babu, those announcements will be coming." "One will be with Charan (Ram Charan), one will be with Allu Arjun," he added. Koratala's 'Acharya', which stars Chiranjeevi, will release on April 29.

248.title: Hardik's showing discipline with the bat, his thinking cap's on: Gavaskar
248.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said GT captain Hardik Pandya is showing discipline while batting in IPL 2022, adding that his "thinking cap" is on. "Hardik is batting well in the powerplay and making full use of the field restrictions," stated Gavaskar. Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra said Hardik has learnt the "right lessons" from MS Dhoni whom he is very close to.

249.title: Expect Root to continue his brilliance with bat in Tests: Ben Stokes
249.article_body: English all-rounder Ben Stokes has said that he expects batter Joe Root to continue his "brilliance" after the latter resigned as the captain of the English Test side last week. "Now that he (Root) has stood down, I fully expect him to continue his brilliance with bat...and show why he is the greatest batsman we've ever produced," Stokes said.

250.title: BJP MP demands apology from Raj CM on 300-yr-old temple's demolition
250.article_body: After a 300-year-old Shiva temple was demolished in Rajasthan's Alwar, a delegation led by BJP MP Swami Sumedhanand Saraswati visited the spot to take stock of the situation. Saraswati demanded an apology from Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on the incident, adding that an FIR should be registered against the officials responsible. He further demanded that the temple should be reconstructed.

251.title: Don't give us threats of imposing President's rule here: Sanjay Raut
251.article_body: Reacting to MP Navneet Rana's threat of chanting Hanuman Chalisa outside Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray's residence, 'Matoshree' in Mumbai, Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut said, "If you try to come to our residence, then we also have the right to answer in the same language." "Don't give us threats of imposing President's rule here," Raut added.

252.title: After Shiva temple, Gaushala demolished in Rajasthan's Alwar
252.article_body: A 'gaushala' (cow shelter) was reportedly demolished in Rajasthan's Alwar district on Saturday, just a day after a 300-year-old Shiva temple was allegedly bulldozed in the same district as a part of an anti-encroachment drive. Blaming Congress government for the demolitions, BJP MP Swami Sumedhanand Saraswati said, "We demand an FIR should be registered against the officials who did this."

253.title: 7 doctors of Maha govt hospital booked for medical negligence over 16-yr-old's death
253.article_body: Seven doctors of the government medical college and hospital in Maharashtra's Yavatmal have been booked for medical negligence over the death of a 16-year-old boy last year, police said. The boy's mother claimed her son, who was suffering from sickle cell disease, was shifted from one ward to another. He was subsequently moved to the medicine ward, where he died.

254.title: Avika Gor to star in Vikram's '1920 - Horrors of...'; Krishna Bhatt to direct
254.article_body: 'Balika Vadhu' actress Avika Gor is set to star in '1920 - Horrors of the Heart', an upcoming film which will be produced by Vikram Bhatt and directed by his daughter, Krishna Bhatt. It is penned by Mahesh Bhatt. Krishna, taking to Instagram, wrote, "Super excited to be making this one with my heart...and my mentors Vikram and Mahesh Bhatt."

255.title: Pornography course where students will 'watch porn films' offered by US college
255.article_body: A college in the US is offering a course on pornography, as a part of which students will "watch pornographic films together and discuss sexualisation of race, class and gender". The Westminster College course catalogue said that the elective course will study "hardcore pornography", which is "as American as apple pie and more popular than Sunday night football".

256.title: Why was the full-toss bowled by RR against DC not referred to third umpire?
256.article_body: On-field umpires didn't refer the full-toss bowled by RR in last over against DC to third umpire to check whether it was waist high, resulting in a controversy. As per IPL playing conditions, had the batter been dismissed on that delivery, the umpires could've referred it to third umpire. Umpires can refer to the third umpire only for front-foot no-balls.

257.title: Which batters have scored the most runs in first 7 matches of an IPL season?
257.article_body: RR's Jos Buttler has set the record for scoring the most runs in first seven matches of an IPL season. He set the record after aggregating 491 runs in his first seven matches of IPL 2022. The previous record was held by Chris Gayle, who scored 436 runs in IPL 2011. Glenn Maxwell follows Gayle, with 435 runs in 2014.

258.title: I was totally shocked: Rashid on reception from crowd in Dehradun during T20I
258.article_body: Sharing his opinion on the reception from the crowd in Dehradun during a T20I between Afghanistan and Bangladesh, Afghanistan spinner Rashid Khan said, "I was totally shocked...The way they were cheering my name...was unbelievable." "That time will never go away from my mind," added Rashid. Rashid is representing GT in IPL 2022 and has picked six wickets so far.

259.title: US crypto-mining firm looks to sell gear worth $30 mn stuck in Russia
259.article_body: US-based cryptocurrency-mining firm Compass Mining is seeking to sell gear worth $30 million in Siberia after one of its rivals got sanctioned by the US over Russian operations. It's seeking to sell its mining equipment with 12 megawatts of capacity that can't be moved out of Russia. It will distribute the proceeds to about 2,000 clients that own the gear.

260.title: 'Anti-minority' image can hurt Indian companies: Raghuram Rajan
260.article_body: RBI's ex-Governor Raghuram Rajan has said that "anti-minority" image could damage the market for Indian products and result in foreign governments perceiving India as an unreliable partner. "If we're seen as a democracy treating our citizens respectfully...we become much more sympathetic. (Consumers say) 'I'm buying this stuff from this country which is trying to do the right thing'," he said.

261.title: Binance denies report of it agreeing to share user data with Russia
261.article_body: Binance has responded to a Reuters report which claimed it agreed to give users' data to Russian FSB-linked agency Rosfin, saying it's a false claim. "Inaccurate article by irresponsible journalists," Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao said. The report had also said around the time Binance executive met Rosfin in 2021, Rosfin was seeking to trace Bitcoin funding of Kremlin-critic Alexey Navalny.

262.title: Tamil Nadu to set up 600 village secretariats: CM MK Stalin
262.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Friday announced that 600 village secretariats will be set up for effective implementation of various government schemes. The village secretariats would have a chamber for the village panchayat president, conference halls and offices for other officials, and each of them would be constructed at an estimated cost of ₹40 lakh each, Stalin added.

263.title: Woman jumps from 8th floor to escape man with 'ghost gun' in US
263.article_body: A US woman is in critical condition after she jumped from the eighth floor of an apartment building to escape an attacker with a "ghost gun", who had bound her arms and legs, police said. "Prior to the victim's fall, the victim and suspect were involved in a dispute," police added. The accused, who'd fled the scene, has been arrested.

264.title: 40 hospitalised due to food poisoning after eating at feast in Odisha village
264.article_body: As many as 40 persons were hospitalised due to food poisoning after consuming food at a feast during a function in a village in Odisha. The patients were initially admitted to a local hospital in Jajpur and later 10 of them were referred to the district hospital. According to a doctor at the district hospital, the patients' conditions are better.

265.title: Watched Alia Bhatt's 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' 4-5 times in theatre: Mrunal
265.article_body: Mrunal Thakur in an interview praised Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Gangubai Kathiawadi', saying that she watched the film four-five times in a theatre. She added she wanted to be a part of the film as it "felt very personal". "It was such a bold...subject. This is how I started my career, with a film based on brothels and sex trafficking," said Mrunal.

266.title: I seek films to push me out of comfort zone, KGF 2 is that film: Sanjay
266.article_body: Actor Sanjay Dutt on Saturday shared a note on social media writing that he seeks out films which push him out of his comfort zone, adding that 'K.G.F: Chapter 2' is that film. He further wrote, "This film will always be a reminder that every time life pops a surprise, you have it in you to do better than that."

267.title: New Zealand reports first case of 'XE' COVID-19 variant
267.article_body: New Zealand has reported its first case of COVID-19 variant, 'XE', the country's Health Ministry said on Saturday. The variant, a mutation of the BA.1 and BA.2 Omicron strains, was found in a person who'd arrived in New Zealand from overseas, it added. "XE has been spreading overseas, and its arrival in New Zealand isn't unexpected," the ministry said.

268.title: I would've been absolutely furious: Cutting on no-ball call in RR-DC match
268.article_body: Reacting to umpires not checking with the third umpire for a potential waist-high no-ball in the final over of DC's match against RR, ex-KKR all-rounder Ben Cutting said, "If I was the batter, I would have been absolutely furious." "[I would've]...probably given the umpires both barrels," added Cutting. DC captain Rishabh Pant was seen calling the team's batters back.

269.title: Pune civic body starts cleanup of Pashan lake
269.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation has started cleanup of Pashan lake in the city in an effort to restore the water body, an official said. The workers are removing water hyacinth and construction debris from the lake, according to a report. After the cleanup, an approach will be developed for hyacinth management, a lake restoration panel member said.

270.title: Iran Revolutionary Guard General survives as gunmen kill his bodyguard
270.article_body: Gunmen on Saturday morning opened fire on a car carrying the General of Iran's paramilitary Revolutionary Guard, killing a bodyguard, state media reported. The attack on Brigadier General Hossein Almassi reportedly took place near a checkpoint in the provincial capital Zahedan. Almassi wasn't injured in the attack, the official news agency IRNA said, adding the attackers have been arrested.

271.title: As an Australian, I would hate to pick Karthik for T20 WC 2022: Lynn
271.article_body: Discussing wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik's potential selection in Team India's squad for T20 World Cup 2022, Australian opener Chris Lynn said, "As an Australian, [I would] hate to pick Karthik because he is such a...weapon for them." "Karthik can just go and whack the ball," added Lynn. Karthik is representing RCB in IPL 2022 where his current strike rate is 205.88.

272.title: Woman dies after husband smashes her face onto floor in Delhi
272.article_body: A 32-year-old woman, a native of Jharkhand, died after her 35-year-old husband allegedly punched and repeatedly smashed her face onto the floor in Delhi, police said. The incident took place at the husband's brother's house in Budhpur when a scuffle broke out between the couple, police added. The husband has been arrested and sent to judicial custody, police further said.

273.title: Cannot implement ₹24,713-cr deal with Future Group: Reliance
273.article_body: Reliance Industries on Saturday said its ₹24,713-crore deal with Future Retail Group "cannot be implemented" after the latter's secured creditors rejected it. However, Future Retail's unsecured creditors and shareholders had voted in favour of the scheme. Future Retail in 2020 had announced the ₹24,713-crore deal to sell its retail, wholesale and other assets to Reliance Retail Ventures Ltd.

274.title: BJP will hold early elections in Himachal & Gujarat, claims Kejriwal
274.article_body: Addressing a rally in Himachal Pradesh's Kangra, AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal claimed that the BJP will hold early elections in Himachal Pradesh and Gujarat. He, however, added that "it doesn't matter whenever BJP conducts elections, power should come in the hands of common man." "BJP is scared of AAP in Himachal and Gujarat...Actually they're scared of the public," he added.

275.title: Delhi government revokes closure notices issued to 400 hotels
275.article_body: Delhi government on Saturday revoked closure notices which Delhi Pollution Control Committee had issued to about 400 hotel owners in the Paharganj and Karol Bagh area. This comes after a delegation of the affected hotel owners met Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai. Earlier, AAP MLA Vishesh Ravi had also written a letter to Rai requesting relief for the hotel owners.

276.title: Will put Karthik ahead of everyone including Pant: Harbhajan on T20 WC 2022
276.article_body: Talking about Team India's potential squad for T20 World Cup 2022, ex-India spinner Harbhajan Singh said he will put wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik "ahead of everyone" including Rishabh Pant. "Karthik should be your first choice going to Australia," added Harbhajan. Harbhajan stated that Karthik has been "unbelievable" for RCB in IPL 2022, having looked "quite off-colour" in IPL 2021 for KKR.

277.title: Future Lifestyle Chairman resigns after creditors reject Reliance deal
277.article_body: Future Lifestyle Fashions' Chairman Shailesh Haribhakti has resigned from his position with immediate effect. Citing the "volatile, complex and unpredictable circumstances" of Future Lifestyle, Haribhakti said, "I feel constrained to act further." The development comes a day after the company's secured creditors rejected the deal to sell Future's retail assets to Reliance Industries.

278.title: Success can lead to disillusions, my family are my mentors: Janhvi
278.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor has stated that extreme success and extreme failure can lead to many kinds of disillusions, adding that she wants to keep that in check. "I feel it is counterproductive to your growth and as an artist," she added. The actress further said her sisters Khushi and Anshula, her brother Arjun and her father Boney are her mentors.

279.title: Bowlers are getting 'canned' left, right and centre in IPL 2022: Lee
279.article_body: Discussing the partnership of 165 runs off 74 balls between Robin Uthappa and Shivam Dube in CSK's win against RCB, ex-Australia pacer Brett Lee said, "Dube absolutely pulverised the bowlers...It was brutal...beautiful...unforgettable." "Bowlers are getting canned left, right and centre [in IPL 2022]," added Lee. Dube scored an unbeaten 95 off 46 balls with Uthappa scoring a 50-ball 88.

280.title: It was a full toss, umpire sticked to decision: Samson on no-ball issue
280.article_body: After the no-ball controversy that took place in Friday's match between RR and DC, RR captain Sanju Samson said that the delivery bowled by Obed McCoy was a "full toss". "The umpire gave it a normal ball. But the batsman wanted it as a no-ball. I think the umpire made his decision...and stuck to it," Samson said.

281.title: Sonam will be perfect mom, she'll do even better films afterwards: Anil
281.article_body: Actor Anil Kapoor in an interview stated that his daughter actress Sonam Kapoor is a perfectionist, adding that she would be a perfect mother too. He further said that Sonam is all heart and is very generous and very giving. "I'm sure she's going to do even better films after she delivers and gets back to work," the actor added.

282.title: Varun's economy rate is 10 or 11 every game, doesn't get wickets: Chawla
282.article_body: Cricketer-commentator Piyush Chawla said KKR spinner Varun Chakaravarthy's economy rate is 10 or 11 in every game, and he doesn't pick wickets as well. Chawla added that KKR's bowling is one of the "main" reasons behind their three consecutive losses. Varun has picked four wickets in IPL 2022 so far. He conceded 30 runs in two overs against RR.

283.title: India Post issues public warning against fake websites
283.article_body: The India Post warned public against fake websites that claim to provide government subsidies through participation in surveys and other means. "We wish to inform...that India Post is not involved in any such activities like announcing subsidies, bonuses or prizes based on surveys, etc," read the Ministry's official statement. It requested the public not to respond to such "spurious messages".

284.title: Old video of 'Bhagwan aur Khuda' poem read by Manoj Bajpayee goes viral
284.article_body: Amid cases of communal tensions in the country, a 2020 video of poem titled 'Bhagwan aur Khuda', featuring Manoj Bajpayee as the narrator, is going viral. Milap Zaveri, who wrote the poem, recently tweeted the video. "Bhagwaan aur Khuda aapas mein baat kar rahe the...ki haath jode huye ho ya dua me uthe, koi farak nhi padta," the poem read.

285.title: Retd TN Police officer leaves loaded pistol with 8 bullets in train, collects it later
285.article_body: A retired senior Tamil Nadu Police official left his pistol loaded with eight bullets in Yercaud Express train and deboarded, an official of Southern Railway said. The loaded pistol was found in the HA1 compartment by a train attendant. On inquiry, it was found retired IGP Ponn Manickavel had travelled in that coach who later came and collected the pistol.

286.title: India wants to be friends with the West, but needs Russia: Sitharaman
286.article_body: India wants to be strong friends with the liberal West but needs Russia's assistance to defend its borders, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has said. In an apparent reference to Pakistan and China, Sitharaman said, "You have a neighbour, who joins hands with another neighbour, both of whom are against me." India is the world's top buyer of Russian weapons.

287.title: Putin grounds daughter from holiday over fear she won't return to Russia: Reports
287.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has grounded his eldest daughter from travelling abroad over fear she won't return to Russia, according to reports. Maria Vorontsova wanted to fly to a country for a beach vacation with her partner Yevgeny Nagorny, reports said. Maria has an eight-year-old son with her ex-husband Jorrit Faassen.

288.title: Foetal exposure to medicines can affect newborn's brain: Study
288.article_body: Foetal exposure to medicines like antiepileptics or antidepressants may affect the development of the newborn brain networks, a study has found. The study by University of Helsinki stated that taking antidepressants show effect on local cortical networks while antiepileptics had drug-specific effects on brain-wide networks. These drugs affected brain networks, reactive to changes in sleep stages.

289.title: Family of brain dead woman hit by BMW in Mangaluru donate her organs
289.article_body: The family of 47-year-old Preethi Manoj, who was declared brain dead after meeting a fatal road accident, have decided to donate her organs in Mangaluru. Preethi was riding her two-wheeler when a speeding BMW car hit her after jumping over the divider, leaving her critically injured on April 9. Police have arrested the driver of the BMW car.

290.title: Maharashtra govt spent ₹1.4 crore on its ministers' COVID-19 treatment: RTI
290.article_body: The Maharashtra government has spent ₹1.40 crore for COVID-19 treatment of its ministers since the pandemic began, as per information obtained under the Right to Information (RTI) Act. The state government reportedly cleared bills worth ₹41.38 lakh to Bombay Hospital, ₹26.27 lakh to Lilavati hospital and ₹15.37 lakh to Breach Candy Hospital. Five ministers reportedly spent over ₹10 lakh each.

291.title: Refrain from airing sensational content: Centre issues advisory for TV channels
291.article_body: Expressing concern over the content shown on TV channels, the Centre issued an advisory asking channels to refrain from airing 'misleading and sensational content'. It added, the channels had been making false claims about the Ukraine war and were "aggravating communal tensions" through the coverage of the Jahangirpuri violence. Channels have been using 'scandalous headlines', it added.

292.title: 15-year-old girl raped in West Bengal; 4 including BJP worker arrested
292.article_body: A 15-year-old girl was allegedly raped by a 32-year-old man in West Bengal's North 24 Parganas, police said. The accused, his minor relative, a woman BJP worker and her son were arrested in this connection. The girl's family claimed the BJP worker and her son were guarding her house, where the crime took place, at the time of the incident.

293.title: Man sent flying after car hits his bike in Ghaziabad, CCTV video surfaces
293.article_body: A motorcycle rider was sent flying over the roof of a car that hit the two-wheeler in the Ghaziabad area of NCR. The incident was captured on CCTV footage which showed the man being airborne after being hit by a red car, before landing on the road, in Wave City. He was rushed to the hospital and remains critical.

294.title: Shilpa joins Sidharth in Rohit Shetty's cop series 'Indian Police Force'
294.article_body: Shilpa Shetty took to Instagram to share that she's going to make her OTT debut with Rohit Shetty's upcoming series, 'Indian Police Force' which also stars actor Sidharth Malhotra. "Ready to set OTT platform on fire for...first time. Super Thrilled to join The Action King Rohit Shetty in his Cop Universe," Shilpa wrote while sharing her look from the series.

295.title: 18-yr-old Alcaraz to break into top 10 with win vs Tsitsipas in Barcelona
295.article_body: Spain's Carlos Alcaraz will enter world's top 10 rankings for the first time next week after the 18-year-old defeated top-seeded Stefanos Tsitsipas 6-4, 5-7, 6-2 in Barcelona Open quarter-finals on Friday. When 11th-ranked Alcaraz officially enters top 10 on Monday, he'll do so at same age, on same date and following the same tournament as compatriot Rafael Nadal in 2005.

296.title: It is time to make Naya Himachal Pradesh: AAP's Arvind Kejriwal
296.article_body: Delhi CM and Aam Aadmi Party chief Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday said that it is time to make 'Naya Himachal Pradesh'. Kejriwal, while addressing a rally in Kangra, requested the people to give AAP a chance to form government in the state. He added, "I urge all the good people in BJP and Congress to leave their parties and join...AAP."

297.title: HC asks UP police to produce woman allegedly abducted by father
297.article_body: Allahabad High Court has directed Senior Superintendents of Police in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj and Jaunpur to produce a woman allegedly abducted by her father from the chamber of her advocate by the next date of hearing. It was hearing an inter-caste marriage case. Over 20 men surrounded the chamber and abducted the woman at her father's behest, her advocates claimed.

298.title: Twitter to pilot crypto payments for some users on platform
298.article_body: Twitter and Stripe will pilot cryptocurrency payments for select users of Twitter's Ticketed Spaces and Super Follows programmes. Eligible users will receive their earnings from Twitter in USD coin, a stablecoin backed by the US dollar. The crypto payments will be routed through Stripe Connect. Users will be able to hold their earnings in crypto wallets on the Polygon network.

299.title: Illegal properties of mafias worth ₹268 cr seized in last 2 years in UP: Official
299.article_body: The Yogi Adityanath-led Uttar Pradesh government has seized illegal properties worth ₹268 crore in the state belonging to mafias in last two years, Additional Chief Secretary Awanish Kumar Awasthi said. "When we confiscate any property, we also see whether the construction is legal or not and accordingly action is taken to destroy it which is also called bulldozing," he added.

300.title: Police submit report to court on medical malpractice at Pune hospital
300.article_body: Pune Police have submitted a report to a local court over alleged malpractice at a private hospital during a kidney transplant procedure, an official said. The report was sought by the court after an application was filed by an NGO in the court, the official added. The regional organ transplant authorisation committee has been temporarily suspended over the incident.

301.title: 13-year-old missing girl found dead in swimming pool in Bareilly
301.article_body: A 13-year-old girl was found dead in a swimming pool in the Hafizganj area of Bareilly, Uttar Pradesh. According to Additional SP (Rural) Rajkumar Agarwal, the girl reportedly went missing and was found dead three hours after the complaint was lodged. Meanwhile, the deceased's father has accused the swimming pool's owner of murder while the police have launched a probe.

302.title: Yes Bank's Rana Kapoor, DHFL promoters laundered ₹5,050 crore, says ED
302.article_body: Yes Bank Co-founder Rana Kapoor and DHFL promoters Kapil and Dheeraj Wadhawan laundered money worth ₹5,050 crore, the Enforcement Directorate (ED) has claimed in its second supplementary chargesheet. The agency said that Rana Kapoor, the Wadhawans and others were "involved in criminal conspiracy with each other in illegal diversion and siphoning off of funds through suspicious transactions".

303.title: 17-yr-old girl killed by father, brother in honour killing case in UP
303.article_body: A 17-year-old girl was allegedly killed by her father and brother in an honour killing case in Uttar Pradesh's Banda on Wednesday, police said. The girl's body was exhumed for a postmortem on Friday which confirmed that she was strangled to death, police added. The girl's family opposed her relationship with a boy of the same caste, police stated.

304.title: Everyone should demand Uniform Civil Code: UP Deputy CM Maurya
304.article_body: UP Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya on Saturday said that everyone should demand and welcome Uniform Civil Code. He said, "UP government is also thinking in this direction...We're in favour of it and it's necessary for UP and...people of [India]." Earlier in March, Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami had said his government has decided to implement the Uniform Civil Code.

305.title: India has its own problems: US President while talking about China, Quad
305.article_body: Talking about China and Quad nations (India, Australia, US, Japan), US President Joe Biden said Xi Jinping told him Quad was formed to affect China. "One of the things that autocrats fear the most, and India has its own problems; all those countries have their own problems, is the notion...we can work together...contrary to what are essentially dictatorships," Biden said.

306.title: 55 test COVID-19 +ve at IIT Madras campus so far; no 'XE' variant detected
306.article_body: A total of 55 persons have tested positive for COVID-19 at the Indian Institute of Technology, Madras campus in Tamil Nadu's Chennai in the last few days. "All infected patients have mild symptoms and their condition is stable," state Principal Secretary Health Dr J Radhakrishnan said. According to him, 'XE' variant has not been detected in the state so far.

307.title: GT become first team in IPL 2022 to choose to bat first after winning the toss
307.article_body: GT have become the first team to choose to bat first after winning the toss in IPL 2022. GT captain Hardik Pandya opted to bat first against KKR in their IPL 2022 clash. In the first 34 matches of the tournament, captains had opted to bowl first after winning the toss. KKR have made three changes to their playing XI.

308.title: 5 women, 1 boy of family killed as truck rams into jeep in Maha's Beed
308.article_body: At least five women and a boy of a family from Maharashtra's Latur were killed as the jeep they were travelling in was hit by a truck in Beed district on Saturday, police said. The accident took place around 10.30 am near Saigaon village in Ambajogai tehsil, police added. "Victims were going Ambajogai to attend a programme," police further said.

309.title: There is nobody who is anybody's fan in our house: Anil Kapoor
309.article_body: Actor Anil Kapoor, speaking about his children actors Sonam and Harsh Varrdhan and producer Rhea, stated that there is nobody who is anybody's fan in their house. He further said that their whole family is very independent and has their own point of view on everything. "I don't want to tell them, 'You do this, you do that'," Anil added.

310.title: Beijing on alert after COVID-19 cases discovered in school
310.article_body: China's capital city Beijing is on alert after 10 middle school students tested positive for COVID-19, in what the officials said was an initial round of testing. Officials have suspended classes in the school for a week. China is currently facing its worst COVID-19 outbreak since the beginning of the pandemic in the central city of Wuhan.

311.title: Trees planted at Pune Airport to mark Earth Day; pics surface
311.article_body: Pune Airport on Friday took to Twitter to share pictures of tree plantation by officials of the Airports Authority of India and SpiceJet on the occasion of Earth Day. One picture shows an official digging the ground to plant a tree sapling. Earth Day is celebrated annually on April 22, since it was first observed in 1970.

312.title: Raj Kundra again spotted wearing outfit entirely covering his face at airport, pics viral
312.article_body: Businessman Raj Kundra was again spotted wearing an outfit that entirely covered his face. Reacting to pictures of Kundra in the outfit from Mumbai airport going viral, a social media user commented, "This type of face coverings shouldn’t be allowed for security reasons." Other comments read, "Next generation Spiderman loading" and "Just trying to get attention."

313.title: 236 fibroids removed from woman's uterus in B'luru in new world record
313.article_body: A 34-year-old Bengaluru journalist entered the Guinness Book of World Records after she had 236 fibroids weighing over 2.25 kg, removed from her uterus last year. Ritika Sharma had a four-and-a-half-hour surgical procedure performed on her, in which fibroids as large as a cauliflower were also removed. Fibroids are noncancerous tumours which lead to heavy menstrual bleeding, back pain etc.

314.title: China's top scientist loses $2 bn wealth amid questions over his COVID-19 drug
314.article_body: China's top scientist Wu Yiling's wealth declined by $2 billion after shares of his company, Shijiazhuang Yiling Pharmaceutical, plunged 35% in the past two weeks. The company's stock fell after the son of a Chinese tycoon questioned the efficacy of Wu's drug used to treat COVID-19. The medicine has also been recommended by the Chinese government for treating mild cases.

315.title: 'Himachal too will get honest govt,' Arvind Kejriwal tells CM Jairam Thakur
315.article_body: Replying to Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Jairam Thakur's "Delhi's model is not acceptable in Himachal" comment, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal said, "Delhi model means honest government." He further asserted, "Like Punjab and Delhi, now AAP will give honest government in Himachal...too." Jairam had earlier said societal and political circumstances in Delhi and Himachal are different.

316.title: Each COVID-19 infected person infecting 2 others in Delhi: IIT Madras study
316.article_body: Delhi's R-value, which indicates the spread of COVID-19, was recorded at 2.1 this week, implying that every infected person is infecting two others, according to an analysis by IIT-Madras. However, Assistant Professor Dr Jayant Jha said it would be too early to declare an onset of another wave. India's R-value, at present, stands at 1.3, the analysis found.

317.title: Video captures moment when shark bites a camera undersea in Maldives
317.article_body: An underwater camera captured what it is like to be eaten by a shark when it bit on a filmmaker’s equipment in the Maldives. The filmmaker was shooting an undersea documentary when a tiger shark took a bite of his 360-degree camera, giving a glimpse into its mouth and throat. However, the shark later released the camera from its jaws.

318.title: UN chief to meet Putin and Zelenskyy next week
318.article_body: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres will visit Moscow next week to meet Russian President Vladimir Putin and then head to Ukraine for talks with President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. Guterres on Tuesday had called for a four-day pause in fighting in Ukraine ahead of Orthodox Easter on Sunday to allow for the safe passage of civilians from hard-hit areas, but it "wasn't heeded".

319.title: Will induct ground-level leaders from BJP, Cong in Himachal: AAP
319.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party leader Satyendar Jain said that the party will induct ground-level leaders from the BJP and the Congress in Himachal Pradesh. "Only top leaders of BJP and Congress will remain and the rest we will clear. We are doing background checks and will only take good people. AAP will work honestly in Himachal Pradesh," he said.

320.title: Last few years haven't been great for me in terms of my career: Shreyas
320.article_body: Shreyas Talpade has said that the last few years have not been really great for him in terms of his career, adding that he was "pretty much written off". The actor, who was recently seen in 'Kaun Pravin Tambe?', added, "To bounce back is...a blessing. You need to do your work and wait for time to turn around for you."

321.title: Europe saw its warmest summer on record in 2021
321.article_body: Scientists have said that Europe saw its warmest summer on record in 2021, with temperatures a full 1°C higher than the average for the previous three decades. However, the European Union's Copernicus Climate Change Service found that spring 2021 was cooler than average. Summer was marked by "severe and long-lasting heatwaves" that saw numerous new temperature records.

322.title: Principal has sex with teacher in Chhattisgarh school; suspended after video gets leaked
322.article_body: A principal of a government school in Chhattisgarh's Kanker has been suspended allegedly after a video of him having sex with a teacher in school building surfaced. He was reportedly caught in a sting operation by locals. District Education Officer TR Sahu said a complaint was received in this regard and an investigation was conducted.

323.title: Regular blood donation can remove toxic 'forever chemicals' from body: Study
323.article_body: According to a study donating blood regularly helps in eliminating toxic 'forever chemicals' from the body. 'Forever chemicals', also known as PFAS, are widely present in non-stick kitchenware, water-resistant material and other household products. They enter our body through air, water or food and keep accumulating in blood serum. They impact gut flora or lungs, causing asthma and other diseases.

324.title: Woman falls into open manhole while talking on phone in Bihar, video viral
324.article_body: A video has surfaced online where a woman while talking on her phone, falls into an open manhole in Bihar. The clip showed her walking behind an autorickshaw while talking on the phone and when the vehicle moves forward, she falls into the hole. While the sewer vent was seven to eight feet deep, bystanders managed to rescue her safely.

325.title: 19 crude bombs, pistol found in abandoned auto near children's home in Kolkata
325.article_body: Nineteen crude bombs, a country-made pistol and two cartridges were seized from an abandoned auto-rickshaw near a children's home in Kolkata's Haridevpur, police said. Law enforcers, after receiving a tip-off, conducted a raid and found three abandoned auto-rickshaws on a ground near the home. Investigation is underway to ascertain whether the bombs were part of a terror plot, police added.

326.title: I've a pear-shaped body, was called 'Indian Kardashian' in US: Mrunal
326.article_body: Actress Mrunal Thakur in an interview said that she has a "pear-shaped body" and she "takes a lot of pride in it". "When I was in US, people said a lot of women pay to get that body," she added. "When someone called me the Indian Kardashian, I was so happy that yes we need to celebrate," Mrunal further said.

327.title: Buttler is after Kohli's record of highest runs in an IPL season: Irfan
327.article_body: Discussing RR opener Jos Buttler's 116 off 65 balls against DC, ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan tweeted, "Buttler is after Virat Kohli's record of highest runs in [an IPL] season. Flawless batting." Buttler has scored 491 runs in seven IPL 2022 matches so far. Kohli scored 973 runs in IPL 2016 and holds the record for highest runs in a season.

328.title: It was a 'blowout' game for us: SRH's Steyn on 61-run loss against RR
328.article_body: SRH fast bowling coach Dale Steyn said his team's loss by 61 runs in their IPL 2022 opener against RR was a "blowout" game for them. "We will go through some rocky times...hopefully we can handle the situation if it arises," added Steyn. Steyn stated that SRH pacer Umran Malik should be included in Team India "as soon as possible".

329.title: I've no plans to join BJP but I welcome their recent decisions: Hardik Patel
329.article_body: Congress leader Hardik Patel refuted the rumours of him joining BJP and said, "I've no plans to join BJP." "I welcome the political decisions that have been taken by BJP recently. The party is strong in Gujarat as they have leadership with decision-making abilities," he added. Patel further stated that Congress needs to work on its decision-making skills.

330.title: Nepal-based racketeer sentenced to imprisonment in an 8-yr-old case
330.article_body: A Nepal-based racketeer was sentenced to five years of imprisonment in a case, which took place in April 2014, linked to the recovery of Fake Indian Currency Notes (FICN) at the IGI Airport in New Delhi. The National Investigation Agency said that the accused, Abi Ansar, was caught with FICNs of ₹1,000 denomination that had a face value of ₹49,88,000.

331.title: Pic of Watson calming Rishabh Pant down amid no-ball controversy goes viral
331.article_body: A picture of DC assistant coach Shane Watson trying to calm Rishabh Pant down after the latter called batters back amid last-over no-ball controversy has gone viral. During post-match press conference, Watson said, "DC don't stand for what happened in final over [against RR]...Umpire's decision...whether it's right or wrong...we've to accept. Someone running on to the field...it's not acceptable."

332.title: Speeding SUV hits bike, tosses 3 people into air in Delhi; driver held
332.article_body: The driver of a speeding SUV has been arrested after it hit a motorbike and an autorickshaw in Delhi's Saket last week, police said. The car first hit the motorbike, tossing three people on the bike into the air, police said. The accused's vehicle then hit the autorickshaw, police further said. The driver had fled from the spot, police stated.

333.title: Hyd hospital performs new cervical cancer procedure for 1st time in India
333.article_body: Hyderabad's American Oncology Institute has performed India's first hybrid interstitial brachytherapy procedure using Varian's Aarhus Applicator at its Citizens Specialty Hospital. The procedure was successfully performed on two cervical cancer patients, doctors said. "This advanced form of brachytherapy has shown to improve local control and reduce morbidities," a radiation oncologist said.

334.title: Minorities Rights Day to be observed annually on December 18: TN Minister
334.article_body: December 18, every year, will be observed as Minorities Rights Day in Tamil Nadu, Minister for Minorities Welfare and Non-Resident Tamils Welfare Gingee K S Masthan said on Friday. About ₹2.50 lakh will be provided for the purpose, he added. Moreover, a sum of ₹2.75 crore would also be provided as an aid to the students, the minister said.

335.title: Woman robbed in moving Mumbai local train with toy gun; accused arrested
335.article_body: A woman commuter was robbed of ₹4,000 on a moving local train in Mumbai at gunpoint. The weapon used to threaten the victim was reportedly a toy. "The accused also put a hand in my blouse and took away ₹20 which I'd kept aside for rickshaw fare," she claimed. The accused was arrested in 2019 for extorting passengers at knifepoint.

336.title: Bengaluru police arrest 2 thieves, solve 22 cases; gold recovered
336.article_body: Bengaluru police on Friday solved 22 cases of house robberies across the city after arresting two thieves. One of the accused is a habitual offender while the other learnt how to commit theft through YouTube videos, according to police. The police have also recovered gold worth ₹79.64 lakh, three laptops, 10 phones, six iPads and ₹2 lakh cash, among others.

337.title: UK to reopen embassy in Kyiv: PM Johnson after Ukraine's 'success'
337.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson announced that the UK will open its embassy in the Ukrainian capital next week following "the extraordinary fortitude and...success of [Ukrainian] President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and...Ukrainian people in resisting Russian forces in Kyiv". The embassy was temporarily closed days before Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24. Zelenskyy said he was "grateful" for the UK's decision.

338.title: Reliance bought at least 15 mn barrels of Russian oil since Ukraine invasion: Report
338.article_body: Reliance Industries has ordered at least 15 million barrels of Russian oil since Russia invaded Ukraine in February, said trade sources. It is said that Reliance bought an average of 5 million barrels a month for the June quarter. Before the Ukraine war, Indian refiners, including Reliance, rarely bought oil from Russia owing to its high freight costs.

339.title: Enjoying best form of my life: Buttler after scoring a ton against DC
339.article_body: After scoring a match-winning 116 (65) against the Delhi Capitals, Rajasthan Royals batter Jos Buttler has said that he is "enjoying the best form" of his life. "Was a special knock, enjoyed it...need to continue with this form all the way through. The ball swung...was a bit tricky...You need to soak up that pressure and come through it," Buttler said.

340.title: Odisha Police looking for woman who hired contract killer to kill husband
340.article_body: Odisha Police are searching for a woman, who hired a contract killer, to eliminate her husband in Bhubaneswar. She is on run ever since her plan didn't materialise. She had reportedly paid ₹1 lakh to the killer, who attacked him with a steel pipe last week. Police have arrested the man's driver, alleged to be her paramour in the case.

341.title: BJP MLA shoes stolen outside temple in UP, wishes well to poor man
341.article_body: BJP MLA Chhotey Lal Verma's shoes went missing while he was inaugurating Mata Sati fair in UP's Agra. The MLA from Fatehabad later walked barefoot back to his car from the temple. Verma said that some poor man must have taken his shoes and added, "I wish Mata Sati to do good to that poor man and keep him happy."

342.title: Tusshar sends me links on parenting, I'm more interested in Lock Upp data: Ekta
342.article_body: Ekta Kapoor in an interview said, "I'm not naturally a parent...My brother (Tusshar Kapoor) is. He's naturally a parent." She added Tusshar sends her links on parenting but she's more interested in reading the data of her show 'Lock Upp'. "I'm very ambitious...I live for my career...I've not moved into my son's life...Rather I've moved him into mine," said Ekta.

343.title: Money laundering case filed against main accused in Jahangirpuri violence
343.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) has filed a money laundering case under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) against Ansar Sheikh, the main accused in the Jahangirpuri violence, officials said. This comes after Delhi Police on Friday asked ED to probe the sources of properties of Sheikh. "We suspect he frequently receives money via shady channels," police had said earlier.

344.title: US official praises SpaceX for handling of Russian jamming attack in Ukraine
344.article_body: Director of Electronic Warfare at Office of the Secretary of Defense Dave Tremper has said the way SpaceX Starlink handled Russia's jamming attacks in Ukraine was "eye-watering". Tremper said SpaceX fixed the attack a day after it was reported and suddenly the attack "was not effective" anymore. "We [US] need to be able to have that agility," Tremper said.

345.title: Pant, Buttler involved in heated argument amid no-ball controversy, video goes viral
345.article_body: A video of DC captain Rishabh Pant and RR's Jos Buttler being involved in a heated argument amid no-ball controversy during their IPL 2022 match has gone viral. Pant had sent assistant coach Pravin Amre on the field to protest umpires' decision. When Amre was on the ground, Buttler was seen having a heated discussion with Pant on boundary line.

346.title: Will Smith seen in Mumbai in his 1st public appearance after Oscars slap controversy
346.article_body: Actor Will Smith was seen in Mumbai in his first public appearance after the Oscars slap controversy. A video of the actor was shared by Bollywood photographer Viral Bhayani on Instagram, which showed Smith waving at his fans. Smith had apologised to comedian Chris Rock after slapping him at Oscars.

347.title: Man hides ₹42 lakh worth gold in rectum, held at Jaipur airport
347.article_body: A man was arrested at Jaipur airport on Friday for illegally concealing 791 gm of gold worth ₹42,79,310 in his rectum, officials said. Yellowish granules packed in three transparent polyethylene capsules were found in the passenger's rectum, officials added. The man, who had arrived from Sharjah, was searched as he looked suspicious due to his manners, an official said.

348.title: 20-year-old man murders landlord in revenge for slap in Gurugram
348.article_body: The Gurugram Police arrested a 20-year-old man for allegedly murdering his former landlord in revenge for being slapped by him.  The victim's cousin Sandeep said that at around 7.15 pm, Deepak (the landlord) spoke to him near his house and was walking towards his car when the accused arrived on a motorcycle and fired several rounds at him and escaped.

349.title: Don't go to Pakistan for higher education; those degrees not valid in India: UGC
349.article_body: University Grants Commission and All India Council for Technical Education have advised students to not travel to Pakistan for higher education, saying those degrees will not be valid in India. "Migrants and their children who have acquired a higher education degree in Pakistan and have been awarded citizenship by India would be eligible for seeking employment in India," they said.

350.title: Musk rejects philanthropy talks with Bill Gates, pics of their chat surface
