350.article_body: A purported text conversation between Elon Musk and Bill Gates has surfaced on social media. While Gates said he wanted to discuss "philanthropy possibilities" with Musk, the latter denied citing Gates' short position against Tesla. Musk also tweeted that he didn't leak the chats and that it wasn't a top secret that Gates was half a billion short against Tesla.

351.title: Musk mocks Bill Gates with Apple's 'pregnant man' emoji, Twitter users react
351.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk took to Twitter to mock Bill Gates with Apple's 'pregnant man' emoji that has been recently rolled out. Sharing a photo of Gates along with the emoji, Musk wrote, "In case you need to lose a boner fast." Reacting to his post, a user wrote, "Is this the guy people want to buy Twitter?"

352.title: Russia wants to capture other countries after Ukraine: Zelenskyy
352.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that Russia's attack on Ukraine is "only a beginning" and Moscow wants to "capture" other countries. His comments came after Russian military commander Rustam Minnekayev said Moscow is planning to seize Ukraine's south and open a corridor to the Russian-occupied Trans-Dniester region of Moldova, as part of the "second phase" of its military operation.

353.title: BJP glorifies Godse, but foreign VIPs taken to Sabarmati Ashram: Shiv Sena
353.article_body: The Shiv Sena in its mouthpiece Saamana has commented on BJP over the recent visit of UK PM Boris Johnson to Ahmedabad's Sabarmati Ashram. "It's a wonder that they (BJP) support the ideology of Nathuram Godse but when foreign guests (like Johnson) arrive, they take them to Gandhi's Sabarmati Ashram to weave the yarn," the editorial in Saamana said.

354.title: Newspaper with 'Recognise genocide of Hindus...' article given in Shatabdi; IRCTC reacts
354.article_body: IRCTC has issued a warning to its onboard services licensee, after an unauthorised publication with 'Genocide of Hindus...under Islamic rule needs to be recognised' article was distributed on Shatabdi Express. The licensee said the paper got circulated as a supplement inserted by the vendor into approved newspapers. "The licensee should stick to the contract conditions," IRCTC said.

355.title: 5 of family including 2-year-old girl murdered at home in UP's Prayagraj
355.article_body: Five members of a family, including a two-year-old girl, were found murdered on Saturday at their home in Khevrajpur in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj, police said. The incident took place on Friday when one of the family members had gone to attend a wedding, police added. Injury marks on the bodies suggest all five were hit on the head, police stated.

356.title: Wasn't right but what happened with us was also not right: Pant on sending Amre on field
356.article_body: Talking about him sending assistant coach Pravin Amre on field to protest umpires' decision of not calling a waist-high no-ball in their match against RR, DC captain Rishabh Pant said, "It wasn't right...but what happened with us was also not right." "It was just heat of the moment," he added. Pant stated third umpire should've interfered and signalled a no-ball.

357.title: Google to ban third-party call recording apps from Play Store from May 11
357.article_body: Google is set to introduce a new policy that will block third-party call recording apps from the Play Store from May 11. Such apps currently use the Accessibility API (designed for people with disabilities) to access the audio functions on Android devices. However, phones that come with an in-built call recording feature will still be able to use the function.

358.title: 21-yr-old woman gang-raped by 4 in Rajasthan's Bharatpur
358.article_body: A 21-year-old woman was allegedly gang-raped by four men at an isolated place in Rajasthan's Bharatpur. They also made a video of the incident and threatened her to make it public if she speaks up. Her father alleged that the accused had kidnapped her at gunpoint. On Wednesday, the girl had left home planning to end her life, police said.

359.title: 21-yr-old TN youth beaten to death by group for being in relationship with girl
359.article_body: A 21-year-old youth died allegedly after a group of people brutally attacked him for being in a relationship with a girl in Tamil Nadu's Thanjavur, police said. The youth was attacked by the group that insisted he should stop getting in touch with the girl, police added. An altercation broke out between the victim and the group over the issue.

360.title: Pant fined 100% of match fee, coach Amre banned for one match over no-ball controversy
360.article_body: DC captain Rishabh Pant has been fined 100% of match fee for breaching IPL Code of Conduct in their match against RR. Pant was seen calling his batters back and sending assistant coach Pravin Amre on to the field to protest umpires' decision of not calling a waist-high no-ball. Amre has been banned for one match.

361.title: Shankar has zero confidence, I would be surprised if GT back him: Chawla
361.article_body: Cricketer-commentator Piyush Chawla said GT all-rounder Vijay Shankar has "zero" confidence, adding he would be "surprised" if the franchise continues to back him despite his inability to perform. Shankar has scored 19 runs in four IPL 2022 matches so far at a strike rate of 54.28. He has reached double figures only once so far in the ongoing edition.

362.title: MBBS student dies after falling from roof at Odisha medical college
362.article_body: A first-year MBBS student has died after he allegedly fell from the roof of the boys hostel at government-run Bhima Bhoi Medical College and Hospital in Odisha's Balangir, police said. The deceased's family claimed that he was being ragged and had either died by suicide or somebody pushed him. However, the college's dean said, "I've never heard about ragging in...hostel."

363.title: Cong block Prez held in Karnataka cop recruitment scam, 11 held till now
363.article_body: A Congress block President, Mahanthesh Patil, was arrested by the CID (Karnataka) in connection with the Police Sub-Inspector recruitment scam. Patil is alleged to have helped another accused, Ayyanna Desai, to cheat during the examination, officials said. The police have arrested 11 people till date, including Desai and Patil, in connection with the recruitment scam held in October 2021.

364.title: Former cricketers react to Pant calling his batters back, RP Singh says 'Not cricket'
364.article_body: Reacting to DC captain Rishabh Pant signalling to call his batters back and sending assistant coach Pravin Amre on to field to protest umpires' decision against RR, ex-India pacer RP Singh tweeted, "Didn't expect Pant could do that...Not cricket." "Bad sportsman spirit on display by DC," wrote Mohammed Azharuddin. "Don't agree with Pant wanting to call...players off," wrote Lisa Sthalekar.

365.title: Punjab govt withdraws security cover of 184 persons including ex-ministers, MLAs
365.article_body: The Punjab government has withdrawn the security cover of 184 persons, including former ministers and MLAs, based on current threat assessment. Personnel deployed on specific orders of the courts, however, would not be withdrawn, as per the official order. Former ministers Bharat Bhushan Ashu, Manpreet Singh Badal, Raj Kumar Verka and Brahm Mohindra are among those who lost security cover.

366.title: Kuldeep relishes the chance to win games for DC, he was unhappy at KKR: Nikhil
366.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Nikhil Chopra said DC spinner Kuldeep Yadav was "not happy" at his former franchise KKR, adding that KKR did not show confidence in Kuldeep. "Kuldeep is relishing the opportunity to take...wickets and win...[games] for DC," stated Nikhil. Kuldeep is currently IPL 2022's second-highest wicket-taker with 13 wickets so far. He recorded a four-wicket haul against KKR.

367.title: BMC ties up with Google Maps to provide live updates on road closures
367.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has announced a tie-up with Google and its partner Lepton to provide live updates about road closures, congestion on roads and alternate travel routes. Various departments of the BMC like sewage, hydraulics, roads and stormwater drains will provide updates to Google and Lepton, who will then update them on the map on a real-time basis.

368.title: Mentally challenged woman gangraped for 20 hours by 3 men in hospital in Andhra
368.article_body: A 23-year-old mentally challenged woman was allegedly gangraped for 20 hours by three men inside a government hospital in Andhra Pradesh's Vijayawada. The men were identified as employees of a commercial organisation hired by the hospital to perform fogging work. Police said that the three men have been arrested.

369.title: 'Doctor Strange in the...' banned in Saudi over gay character: Report
369.article_body: Marvel's 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness', starring Benedict Cumberbatch, has been banned in Saudi Arabia due to the inclusion of a gay character, as per The Hollywood Reporter. According to report, the upcoming film will feature a new hero America Chavez, who's gay in the comics. Earlier, Marvel's 'Eternals' was banned in Saudi Arabia for showing same-sex couple.

370.title: 4 arrested over gang-rape of woman colleague in Assam's Guwahati
370.article_body: Four persons, including a private business establishment's owner, were arrested in Assam's Guwahati over involvement in the alleged gang-rape of a woman colleague. Police said the woman claimed three of her colleagues took her to their rented accommodation near their office for lunch and raped her. She allegedly informed the establishment's owner about it, but he didn't take any action.

371.title: Alia has shown that you don't need a hero if you're good enough: Shahid
371.article_body: Shahid Kapoor in an interview praised actress Alia Bhatt, with whom he worked in 'Shaandaar' and 'Udta Punjab'. He said he's "very proud to see how well she has done...in her career and how she has become such a thorough professional". "She has shown...that you don't need...hero if you're good enough, you can hold (movie) on your own," Shahid said.

372.title: Sena workers protest outside MLA-MP couple's home over 'Hanuman Chalisa' warning
372.article_body: Heavy police force was deployed outside Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray's residence after independent MLA Ravi Rana and his wife independent MP Navneet Rana threatened to chant Hanuman Chalisa outside the premises. Shiv Sena workers on Saturday morning broke through barricades in protest and tried to enter the premises of the couple's residence and dared them to step outside, police said.

373.title: Musk seeks to appeal finding that his 2018 Tesla tweets were false
373.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk is seeking to appeal a US judge's finding that his 2018 tweets about taking Tesla private were false. In a filing, Musk's lawyers argued that the judge "parsed the individual phrases of the various tweets and indicated certain other information should have accompanied the tweets". They also highlighted that Twitter has a character limit per tweet.

374.title: 15 booked for assaulting Bajrang Dal worker, 2 others in Gujarat
374.article_body: As many as 15 persons were booked on Friday for allegedly assaulting a Bajrang Dal worker and two others in Gujarat's Surat, police said. One of the victims, who is a tempo driver, was identified as the Bajrang Dal worker's nephew. The alleged assault took place when the victims went to meet another tempo driver to sort out an issue.

375.title: 1 dead, 27 missing after warship sank in Black Sea last week: Russia
375.article_body: One person has died and 27 others are missing after the Russian warship Moskva sank in the Black Sea last week, Russian news agencies said on Friday, quoting the country's Defence Ministry. The warship sank after an explosion and fire that Ukraine said was caused by a successful missile strike. Russia said the sinking was the result of exploding munitions.

376.title: NHRC issues notice to Raj over deaths of 2 infants at govt hospital
376.article_body: The National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) on Friday issued a notice to the Rajasthan government over media reports on the deaths of two infants at a government-run hospital in Ajmer due to overheating of warmers. The body said that 20 babies were reportedly in the NICU when the incident occurred. The other babies had "narrowly escaped" death, the NHRC added.

377.title: Facts manipulated: SpiceJet on pilot's claims of being 'off rostered' for reporting fatigue
377.article_body: SpiceJet issued a clarification in response to a pilot's allegations of being 'off rostered' as a punitive action for reporting fatigue. It said the allegations were baseless and that selective emails were leaked to manipulate the facts. The company also said the pilot was on the wrong side of the policies while sharing screenshots of the emails exchanged between them.

378.title: Auto-rickshaw driver molests 12-year-old girl in Pune; booked
378.article_body: An auto-rickshaw driver has been booked for allegedly molesting a 12-year-old girl after approaching her under the pretext of inquiring about an address in Pune's Bavdhan on Friday, police said. The incident occurred around 3.10 pm when the girl was returning from a private study room, police added. The girl informed her parents, following which her father filed a complaint.

379.title: Retired IAS officer booked for framing incorrect govt records in Guj
379.article_body: A retired IAS officer, SK Langa who was the collector of Gujarat's Panchmahal-Godhra from April 2017 to August 2018, has been booked for allegedly framing incorrect government records. The complaint pertains to multiple land ownership petitions in which he allegedly favoured three applicants. Langa adopted a "pick and choose" method to save people from criminal proceedings, as per the complainant.

380.title: Man attacks girlfriend for rejecting marriage proposal in Telangana
380.article_body: A man in Telangana's Hanamkonda attacked a woman on her neck with a sharp object for allegedly rejecting his marriage proposal. According to police, the woman belonging to a town area would visit her relatives living in the rural area. She had developed acquaintances with the accused from there. Police have started a search operation to arrest the man.

381.title: Man kills wife over 'speaking to someone on phone' in B'luru; held
381.article_body: A 37-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly murdering his 31-year-old wife in Bengaluru. The accused reportedly told police that he saw his wife speaking to someone on the phone and she didn't "respond properly" when he questioned her, following which he fought and killed her. The incident had occurred on April 17, while the couple's children weren't at home.

382.title: Video of Depp smashing kitchen cabinets shown to court, actor says 'I didn't touch Heard'
382.article_body: An old video recorded by Amber Heard showing Johnny Depp smashing kitchen cabinets while being reportedly drunk was shown to the court amid the actor's defamation suit against his ex-wife. "I did assault a couple of cabinets...but I didn't touch Miss Heard," Depp told the court. "Why was she filming...If she was scared to death...why didn't she leave?" Depp added.

383.title: Pics from IAS 2015 topper Dabi and IAS officer Gawande's wedding reception surface
383.article_body: Pictures from IAS 2015 topper Tina Dabi and IAS officer Dr Pradeep Gawande's wedding reception that was held on Friday have surfaced online. The couple got married on April 20, while their reception took place on April 22 in Jaipur. Dabi is currently posted as Joint Secretary Finance (Tax) to Rajasthan government.

384.title: Starlink is our smart & quick solution to restore telecom: Ukraine
384.article_body: Ukraine Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov commented on internet connection's state in areas that Russia has left, adding that SpaceX's Starlink is Ukraine's "smart and quick solution to restore telecom". He said Russian soldiers are leaving behind "damaged infrastructure and broken internet connection". A Ukrainian telecom firm is using Starlink as a base station till optical cable gets fixed.

385.title: 'Very clear' we don't want India to rely on Russia for defence needs: US
385.article_body: Pentagon Press Secretary John Kirby has said, "We've been very clear with India as well as other nations that we don't want to see them rely on Russia for defence needs." "At the same time, we also value the defence partnership that we have with India...we're looking at ways to improve that going forward," he further said.

386.title: Supply 72,000 tonnes of coal daily to TN: CM Stalin writes to PM Modi
386.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin urged PM Narendra Modi to direct the coal ministry to deliver 72,000 tonnes of coal per day to the state as per the Fuel Supply Agreement at Paradip and Visakhapatnam ports. "Only this step can enable us to maintain an uninterrupted power supply in the state and hence I solicit your personal intervention," Stalin said.

387.title: Fake and baseless: J&K Police on reports of attack on CRPF bunker in Pulwama
387.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Police refuted the rumours of an attack on a CRPF bunker in Tengpora area of Pulwama and called such reports "fake and baseless". "No such incident has taken place," the police confirmed. "General public is requested not to pay heed to the rumours. Rumour mongers shall be dealt with strictly as per law," the police said.

388.title: Rare twin elephant calves born in Karnataka, IFS officer shares video
388.article_body: IFS officer Parveen Kaswan took to Twitter to share a video of twins being born to an elephant in Karnataka's Bandipur Tiger Reserve, an event said to be extremely rare. Kaswan added, "They form less than 1% of total births. So encounters and documentations are very rare. Even raising two calves in wild is also difficult for the mother."

389.title: 3 workers die while cleaning sewage tank in Madurai; 3 booked
389.article_body: Three workers allegedly died due to asphyxiation while clearing a blockage in the motor of a 30-foot deep sewage tank in Tamil Nadu's Madurai on Thursday. "There was no ambulance and we took them to...hospital in a two-wheeler," a relative of one of the workers said. An FIR has been registered against three persons who were maintaining the tank.

390.title: Attempt by Shiv Sena, Maha CM to kill me: BJP leader as mob attacks car in Mumbai
390.article_body: BJP leader Mohit Kamboj has alleged that his car was attacked by a mob in Mumbai while returning home from a wedding, near Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray's private residence. "This was an attempt to kill me by the Shiv Sena and Maharashtra CM...to suppress my voice," Kamboj said. "Governance in Maharashtra proving to be worse than West Bengal," he added.

391.title: Gunman injures 4 in 'sniper-style' shooting in US before taking own life
391.article_body: A gunman opened fire on random victims from a "sniper-type setup" in an apartment building in the US' capital Washington DC on Friday, injuring four people, before taking his own life as police closed in, officials said. The Van Ness neighbourhood was placed under a lockdown as police mounted a door-to-door search for the 23-year-old suspect, identified as Raymond Spencer.

392.title: Many 'unseen hands, organisations' behind Hubballi violence: K'taka Min
392.article_body: Karnataka Home Minister Araga Jnanendra on Friday said that "unseen hands" and "certain organisations" were behind the Hubballi violence that took place on April 16. "The Hubballi incident was to incite large-scale violence there," he added. "Some people are trying to create unrest in the society against a particular community...We know who they are...we will find them," Jnanendra further said.

393.title: Car-washing centre sealed for using groundwater in Gurugram, owner booked
393.article_body: A Gurugram-based car-washing station was sealed after the officials, including Haryana CM's flying squad, found it using groundwater for washing the vehicles. The shop owner, Lilu Ram, was booked on the charges of stealing electricity as well and a fine of ₹1.42 lakh was imposed. Notably, car-washing stations are allowed to use treated water or harvested water only.

394.title: Couple, 3 sons try to convert 2 tribal women in Gujarat; arrested
394.article_body: A couple and their three sons were arrested on Friday for trying to convert two tribal women to Christianity in Gujarat's Tapi at their house, a police inspector said. The women were reportedly in a relationship with two of the accused sons. The father told the women that they were "impure" and the ritual will "purify" them, the inspector added.

395.title: Bihar CM Nitish attends RJD's Iftar party; Tej claims 'secret' talk
395.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Friday attended Iftar party at RJD leader Rabri Devi's residence in Patna and was pictured sitting with the party's Leader of Opposition Tejashwi Yadav and his brother Tej Pratap. Following this, Pratap told ANI, "We'll form a government...I'd a word with Nitish ji secretly." However, Tejashwi said that they'd invited people from all political parties.

396.title: Will never promote religious conversions, PFI should be banned: Goa CM
396.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant criticised Popular Front of India (PFI) over their statement countering his anti-conversion remark and said that he would recommend the Centre to ban the organisation. "We'll never promote religious conversions in the state," he said. PFI had said that people of Goa shouldn't pay attention to the CM's statement and focus on common people's issues.

397.title: With Kapiva Skin Foods, Malaika takes the 30-Day glow challenge
397.article_body: Malaika Arora announced a skin glow challenge to do a photoshoot without make-up after consuming Kapiva's Skin Foods Glow Mix. Within 30 days, it helps boost the production of collagen and glutathione with the goodness of 10+ herbs, claims Kapiva Academy of Ayurveda, adding that it helps to reduce hyperpigmentation, signs of aging, dark circles and boost skin radiance.

398.title: Preity says Madhavan, wife Sarita have 'done a fantastic job' with son Vedaant
398.article_body: Preity Zinta congratulated R Madhavan and his wife Sarita Birje days after their son Vedaant bagged a gold medal at the Danish Open swimming meet. Sharing Madhavan's tweet on Vedaant winning the medal, Preity wrote, "This is such great news. Congrats Madhavan and Sarita. I'm delighted...to see Vedaant shine like this...Both of you have done a fantastic job with him."

399.title: Ukraine postal service faces cyberattack amid Russian warship stamp sale
399.article_body: Ukraine's national postal service Ukrposhta was hit by a cyberattack after the sales of a postage stamp honouring 13 of its soldiers who told a Russian warship "go f*** yourself!" went online. Ukrposhta's Director-General Igor Smelyansky issued an apology to customers. "We are really doing everything...to restore both the online store and other Ukrposhta systems," he added.

400.title: India reports 2,527 COVID-19 cases, 33 deaths in last 24 hours
400.article_body: India reported 2,527 COVID-19 cases and 33 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,451 COVID-19 cases and 54 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 15,079, while the death toll has risen to 5,22,149.

401.title: Video of MS Dhoni storming on to field resurfaces after DC-RR no-ball controversy
401.article_body: After DC captain Rishabh Pant sent assistant coach Pravin Amre on the field to protest umpires not signalling a waist-high no-ball against RR, a video of CSK's MS Dhoni storming on to the field against RR in IPL 2019 resurfaced. Dhoni had entered the field after the bowler's end umpire overturned a waist-high no-ball decision after consulting with square-leg umpire.

402.title: Allu Arjun praises Yash's KGF 2, says 'A spectacular show by Prashanth Neel'
402.article_body: Actor Allu Arjun took to Twitter to praise Yash's latest release 'K.G.F: Chapter 2'. "Swagger performance and intensity by Yash garu...A spectacular show by Prashanth Neel (director) garu. My respect to his vision and conviction," he wrote. Allu Arjun also thanked the team of 'K.G.F: Chapter 2' for "a cinematic experience and keeping the Indian cinema flag flying high".
